Job Description:
CHS Inc. is a leading global agribusiness owned by farmers, ranchers and cooperatives across the United States that provides grain, food and energy resources to businesses and consumers around the world. We serve agriculture customers and consumers across the United States and around the world. Most of our 10,000 employees are in the United States, but today we have employees in 19 countries. At CHS, we are creating connections to empower agriculture.

Summary

CHS has an exciting opportunity in our Information Technology division. We are seeking a Senior Enterprise Data Services Analyst to join our growing team and support our Customer Experience and Sales Enablement Dynamics 365 Product team. You must have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, exceptional analytical problem-solving skills and be able to work independently as well as in a team environment.

Responsibilities
Deliver analytical and reporting solutions from core Dynamics 365, ERP and Data Lake source systems.
Consider business impact, value of data and information management processes.
Leverage data domain experience and best practices to bring creative solutions to complex problems.
Monitor and improve data quality by initiating corrective actions identified through performing root cause analysis.
Work closely with Integration Engineers to create and maintain cross system interrelationship design and documentation.
Facilitate source and target system data migration requirements gathering from process areas and data governance.
Collaborate with business and technical subject matter experts to identify, analyze and document data migration transformation rules from legacy source systems.
Collaborate with business resources and product team resources to design dashboards, reports and other required visualizations.
Analyzes business strategy and user needs, documents specifications, and translates business objectives into proper system requirement specifications.
Analyze conflicts between business and process area data requirements.
Creation and management of project user stories utilizing Azure DevOps.
Create or modify procedures to solve complex problems giving consideration to computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time, and desired results.
Understand and configure Dynamics 365 Sales to integrate with data visualizations.
Minimum Qualifications (required)
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field (or equivalent years of experience, education and training)
4+ years of Information Technology and/or IT Business Systems to include:
Data analysis, analyzing and visualizing raw data to present actionable information for stakeholders
Knowledge of data governance or data management practices
Intermediate to advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office products
Strong analytic skills with attention to detail providing front-end data analysis, requirements gathering, design, testing, documentation implementation, and support of assigned data projects
2+ years of experience with Power BI to include:
Creating and editing visual content including maps, charts, and graphs
Transforming data sets, quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals
Providing visual, technical and editorial guidance
Experience with Data Modeling, ETL and SQL Development
Additional Qualifications
Experience configuring Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales
Experience with Microsoft Power Platform tools
Experience with Microsoft SharePoint and Visio, Azure DevOps and SQL Server
Agile/Scrum framework knowledge, including user story development

Pre-employment screening is based on the job requirements and industry guidelines and may or may not be required for the position. If required, selected candidates must pass pre-employment screenings to include all or a combination of drug, criminal, motor vehicle check, physical requirements and FMSCA Clearinghouse

CHS offers a competitive total compensation package. Benefits include Health, Dental, Vision, Hearing, Life Insurance, Health and Day Care Savings Accounts, Paid Vacation, 401K, Company Funded Pension, Profit Sharing, Long and Short Term Disability, Tuition reimbursement, and Adoption assistance.

CHS is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Our client is seeking an experienced business analyst to support their ERP system, gathering requirements, customizing and configuring the system, and developing processes to support business initiatives.

This is a permanent/FTE role with a hybrid work location - 1-2 days in-office.

Responsibilities

Manage, develop, test, support, and maintain organization's ERP solution, including managing and leveraging consultant and vendor relationships as needed to optimize system performance
Collaborate and partner with internal stakeholders to ensure that organizational needs are satisfied by system features, functionality, process, automation, and upgrades
Develop and maintain documentation for business requirements and process documentation
Establish project and communication plans, ensuring that timelines, status updates, and team accountability are communicated; responsible for project constraints including resources, budget, scope, etc.
Responsible for change control through project lifecycle, including monitoring changes in scope and gaining approval from stakeholders

Requirements

5+ years of experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, Yardi preferred
Experience developing and presenting training materials
Experience with SQL, SSRS, EDMS
Bachelor's degree in IT or related field or equivalent experience

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, age, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, or military or veteran status. We consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

Are you experienced in understanding and analyzing business needs, gathering and documenting business requirements, and facilitating the development of IT solutions to meet those needs? We are seeking an

Generous Benefit Package that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, and Profit Sharing

Chris Uwimana

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.


Responsibilities:

OVERVIEW & SCOPE OF ROLE:

Morgan IT is on a mission to enable and drive the Morgan goals by being a valuable business partner to all Global Business Units and Functions by:

Running Effective and Efficient IT
Delivering Solid Business Foundations
Extracting Maximum Business Value from IT
Driving disruptive innovation

To do so, the OneIT team is currently executing on a strategic roadmap to make significant step changes in IT performance and business value from IT.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & REPONSIBILITIES:
The D365 IT Business Analyst will ensure the line of business applications, primarily Dynamics 365 (D365), can sustain current and future business needs for our businesses. This role is responsible for providing D365 technical and functional expertise, ensuring business requirements are gathered and subsequent technical/functional resolutions are implemented appropriately. In addition, the role will ensure efficient and effective business as usual operation of D365, including remediation of issues.

The D365 IT Business Analyst understands both technology as well as business and is responsible to capture all business requirements in order to ensure proper IT solutions are delivered. The key focus is mapping functional requirements of the Finance & Supply Chain modules in D365, data and processes.
Key Accountabilities
Serves as liaison to business and IT teams to understand business requirements and create and implement solutions as well as understanding root causes of current issues.
Assembling business requirements with requisite analysis and translation into D365 solutions; along with alternative options and recommendations.
Supports designing business solutions that ensure alignment with the architecture principles and standards.
Documents and provides training for newly implemented systems and/or processes using Click Learn
Resolving incidents/issues, with root cause analysis and fix where appropriate, for D365 applications.
Applying functional and technical understanding of D365 to develop new functionality and integrations/interfaces with other systems as required, to support business growth.
Ensuring all aspects of the D365 development lifecycle are completed successfully, incorporating ISV solutions.
Assuring quality of releases (fixes/upgrades/enhancements etc) into production, through thorough testing and first-class environment management.
Ensuring vendor relationships remain transparent and with clearly understood outcomes
Supports Business Information Managers, Project Managers and Solution Architects in writing program / project proposals
Work with business end users to ensure the project meets business needs
Assumes ownership of the process, system, and expands skill base.
Interacts frequently with business process owners.
Conduct unit testing for project deliverables and facilitate user acceptance testing
Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyse data
Qualifications:

WHY SHOULD YOU CONSIDER JOINING US?

At Buhler, we recognize the importance of your contribution and value your expertise.

THE GREAT PAY

We offer competitive pay that reflects your skills and experience.

OUR SOLID BENEFITS

As a team member, you'll be able to enjoy benefits such as dental, vision, health insurance with a health savings account (HSA), short- and long-term disability, a 401(k) with 6% company contribution, 15 vacation days, sick time, maternity and paternity leave, seniority bonuses, and profit sharing.


WHO ARE WE?

Buhler Group is a family-owned Swiss company that creates sustainable innovations for a better world. Our aim is to transform the world's most pressing food and mobility challenges into sustainable technology, process solutions, and business models. In our family-oriented company, personal success goes hand in hand with shared success. When you join our team, you get access to personal development opportunities and exceptional benefits to encourage you to make a difference in the lives of our customers.

Job Information

Buhler is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join the team! The Analyst drives and manages the lead generation, marketing performance reporting and sales reporting processes. They will develop lists of existing and/or potential customers, manage lead cultivation activities, deliver qualified leads to sales team, and manage metrics/reporting systems. The Analyst will also conduct market research, including but not limited to market size, market share and competitive landscape/pricing.
Bühler is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity and inclusion at our company, therefore, it's important that you match us and we match you. Regardless of your gender (m/f/d). We invite you to read more about our commitment to diversity, equality and inclusion on our website: https://bit.ly/40QxJP6

Tasks
Lead generation: Communicate directly with internal and external partners to qualify leads generated through our digital channels
Reporting and analyzing the customer journey through various channels via campaign performance tools, Voice of Customer programs, and various other data inputs
Conduct requirements gathering with multiple stakeholders to enable effective reporting
Market research: developing lists of potential customers within specified target market segments and developing market intelligence regarding market position, competitive activity and other business relevant projects, as requested
Implement and adhere to data governance and data quality practices in a CRM (Customer Relationship Management) environment
Planning, developing lead generation plans
Take initiative to automate manual processes
Must arrive at work promptly and predictably
Performs other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications

Undergraduate degree in Business Intelligence, Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Marketing or equivalent in education and experience
2+ years of progressively responsible experience in a related area
2+ years of formal marketing experience, preferably in B2B durable goods and services
Proficient Excel, Word, and Outlook skills
Data visualization systems experience, PowerBI and Adobe Analytics preferred
Exposure to Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems
Python & DAX programming is a plus
A passion for finding insights from data and solving business problems
A willingness to learn new skills and technologies, as well as to adapt to changing business needs.
Works collaboratively within a group in order to achieve a common goal
Utilizes effective resources and approaches for choosing a course of action for developing appropriate solutions
Attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal communication skills and relationship building skills to effectively work with a variety of people and personalities; able to communicate clearly and effectively in person and in writing internally and externally.
Ability to work with minimal supervision and make decisions independently, effectively, and creatively within established company guidelines
Excellent organizational skills
Able to multi-task and prioritize to ensure workflow efficiency
Speaks and understands English

Who we are:

The Lacek Group is a collection of brilliant, passionate, intellectually curious, and unique people who work on the leading edge of customer engagement. We come to work every day to help our clients build longer-lasting, more profitable customer relationships. We listen, collaborate and celebrate together. We treat each other with kindness and respect. And we believe different perspectives drive innovation, fuel creativity and make our business and communities better.

Together with our parent company Ogilvy, one of the most creative and effective agencies in the world, we believe diversity drives smarter work for our clients — and better business for us. We believe inclusion is essential, and we welcome all who are ready to join our push for positive change. Every single day.

What we need:

We currently have a great opportunity for a Senior Analyst, Data Intelligence to join our team. As a Senior Analyst, Data Intelligence you will have strong execution skills to create data outputs supporting personalized marketing interactions and provide meaningful datasets to support needs for clients ranging over a wide array of projects. Your key responsibilities will include designing and executing marketing campaigns, supporting measurement and reporting, driving process optimization, developing business partner relationships, and communication across clients and multi-vendor business partners.

What you'll do:

Develop and leverage deep understanding of the client's customer data
Assist client and account team with campaign planning, and identification of analytical needs
Understand business rules and document requirements for marketing campaigns and promotions
Design and execute campaign processes to create data outputs supporting personalized marketing interactions
Support peers with code peer reviews and queries to audit campaigns and/or analysis
Manage multiple projects and deliverables in a fast-paced environment
Optimize and enhance current processes to increase efficiency and value to our clients
Ability to drive and champion projects in a multi-vendor environment
Communicate with technical and non-technical audiences

What you'll bring:

Bachelor's degree in relevant field of study required, plus 4+ years of relevant experience OR Master's degree in relevant field of study, plus 2+ years of relevant experience
SQL experience
Experience with to Adobe Campaign preferred, but not required
Ability to effectively communicate across various roles and functions
Self-motivated/self-starter, and ability to work independently as well as collaborate with a team
Attention to detail
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Naturally inclined to learn, ask questions and understand why
Data mining skills and query data to provide summarized data to support marketing campaigns and reporting
Soft skills necessary to succeed: open to feedback, open to change, self-improvement

Competencies you'll demonstrate:

Adaptability
Agency Citizenship
Building Trust
Coaching
Collaboration
Continuous Improvement (Campaign Operations-focused roles)
Follow-up
Initiating Action
Quality Orientation
Technical / Professional Skills

You'll love working at The Lacek Group – smart people, great environment, engaging culture, comprehensive benefits and fantastic growth opportunities. Your confidential inquiry is encouraged.




The Lacek Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Eaton’s Energy Automation Solutions (EAS) business is currently seeking a ReSurge Program: Business Intelligence Analyst. Are you looking to change industries or functions from your previous experience? Eaton’s ReSurge Program is designed to support people just like you with both your professional and personal goals. Please note the Eaton ReSurge cohort will begin their 12-month assignment in April of 2024.

Eaton provides a competitive total rewards package commensurate with applicable skills, knowledge, and experience and consistent with internal and external market practices. The annual salary for this role is $90,000 a year.

Eaton’s 12-month paid returnship will give participants a multitude of opportunities to make an impact across a global organization. Participants will work to solve real-world challenges while refreshing the skills necessary to be a leader in our organization. You will gain enriching and diverse experiences and work side-by-side with experienced leaders and mentors to power your career. Successful participants may be eligible for full-time employment opportunities upon completion of the program.

All ReSurge participants will join a cohort with a unique learning and development experience. Each participant’s assignment experience will be customized to help them reach their highest potential; no two participants will have the same experience or set of responsibilities.

What you’ll do:

Business Intelligence Analyst:

The Business Intelligence Analyst will work with cross-functional teams across the business to transform data into value-added insights that can drive efficiencies in processes. You will be consolidating data from various sources, creating maintainable data models, and reporting that is intuitive and actionable. The position will require proficiency in data manipulation, data analysis, data modeling and visualization skills. Essential duties include:

Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to gather requirements and enhance data management models, driving best practices. Translate requirements into functional interactive dashboards using Power BI.
Document reporting developed solutions for long term maintainability. Create standard operation procedures and provide training to improve business analytics.
Develop improved data governance practices to ensure proper distribution of data, version control, and appropriately release incremental updates/upgrades.
Evaluate operations for inefficiencies and identify areas where you can create, automate, and develop tools to extract knowledge and actionable information.
Support the business with ad hoc reporting as needed
Qualifications:
Required (Basic) qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution
3+ years Power BI and SQL experience to build functional dashboards
Must be able to work in the United States without corporate sponsorship now and within the future
No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidates that currently reside within 50 miles of location will be considered. Active-Duty Military Service member candidates are exempt from the geographical area limitation.

Preferred Qualifications:

1+ year of a voluntary career break from your profession
25% travel may be required.
Deep knowledge writing SQL queries for data preparation and ability to mine data from multiple platforms. Comfortable in complex data environments and understanding of data structures.
Strong ability to troubleshoot and resolve data issues.
Being able to quickly provide meaningful insights from data and apply best practices for reporting.
Be a passionate problem solver - breaking down problems and developing analytical insights.
Passion for automation.
Ability to organize and lead meetings with business and operational data owners.
Ability to clearly communicate complex ideas to report consumers.

Working Title: IT Business Analyst
Job Class: Information Technology Specialist 3
Agency: Minnesota IT Services

Who May Apply: Open to all qualified job seekers
Date Posted: 11/23/2023
Closing Date: 12/05/2023
Hiring Agency/Seniority Unit: Minnesota IT Services
Division/Unit: DEED / .NET Group
Work Shift/Work Hours: Day Shift
Days of Work: Monday - Friday
Travel Required: No
Salary Range: $31.47 - $51.73 / hourly; $65,709 - $108,012 / annually
Job Class Option: Business Analyst
Classified Status: Unclassified
Bargaining Unit/Union: 214 - MN Assoc of Professional Empl/MAPE
End Date: 11/21/2026
FLSA Status: Nonexempt
Telework Eligible: Yes #LI-Hybrid
Designated in Connect 700 Program for Applicants with Disabilities: No
Make a difference in the lives of Minnesotans.

The work you’ll do is more than just a job. Join the talented, engaged and inclusive workforce dedicated to creating a better Minnesota.

Join the 2,500+ professionals of Minnesota IT Services (MNIT) who connect Minnesotans to services that will improve their lives. This position serves our partners at the Department of Employment and Economic Development (DEED). The MNIT DEED team provides technical support to help improve employment conditions in Minnesota. The team supports work that improves workforce and community development, increases business recruitment, and helps Minnesota small businesses to expand into international trade.

Job Summary



Come join MNIT partnering with the Minnesota Department of Employment and Economic Development (DEED) to work on DEED’s Workforce Development Systems. This posting will hire two individuals who will work together, along with other IT professionals and DEED agency professionals, to modernize DEED's Workforce Development Systems and digital services; making them more functional and easier for our customers to navigate.

These positions will perform business analysis functions using a set of tasks and techniques to successfully act as a liaison among stakeholders to help clarify and understand the structure, policies, operations, and to recommend solutions that enable projects to be successful and goals to be met. Your position includes participating in requirements gathering sessions to analyze, define and document business processes, software requirements, data management systems and development of specifications for technology initiatives.

You will work as liaisons between the Business Product Owner, IT staff, and agency business subject matter experts in order to capture requirements and functional specifications. Much of your time will be spent documenting and validating requirements and understanding business processes and translating them into configured, procured, and developed functionality.

The incumbents will get to participate in and practice: Business Analysis Planning and Monitoring; Elicitation; Requirements Management and Communication; Enterprise Analysis; Requirements Analysis; and Solution Assessment and Validation using industry best practices for generally accepted standards outlined in the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK), or equivalent industry standards and best practices, and by MNIT.

This position is temporary and includes full state fringe benefits; it is anticipated to last for up to three (3) years.

**We will be filling a total of two (2) vacancies from this one posting. All applicants will be considered for both vacancies.

This position is currently eligible for full-time telework:

Telework for Minnesota IT Services allows an employee to perform work from a telework location and an employee may be required to be in the office based on business needs and other dependencies in St. Paul, Minnesota.

Only candidates located in Minnesota and bordering states (Iowa, North Dakota, South Dakota, or Wisconsin) are telework eligible.

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications

Candidates must clearly demonstrate all of the following qualifications in their resume:

This position requires a minimum of three (3) years of experience in performing IT business analysis functions.

Experience must include:

Experience eliciting and managing business requirements.
Experience working as a business analyst writing system specifications.
Ability to deliver effective verbal or written messages that facilitate a mutual understanding on both parties.
Customer service skills that include active listening, empathy, and problem-solving.

A master’s degree in Information Technology or a related field substitutes for three (3) years of experience, OR a related bachelor’s degree substitutes for two (2) years, OR a related associate’s degree substitutes for one (1) year.

Preferred Qualifications
Ability to collaborate and work effectively as part of an Agile team.
Experience using the Microsoft Suite of tools, including Power BI, and Excel to manage and summarize data.
Experience with APIs (e.g., creating, testing, publishing, managing, monitoring, and securing).
Knowledge of and / or experience with Power Apps, Microsoft Azure, and Azure Services (e.g., cloud technologies, managed databases, API Manager).
Experience working with vendor products, configurable products, and commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) product implementations.
Additional Requirements

It is the policy of Minnesota IT Services that a successful candidate must pass all legally required checks prior to employment which may consist of the following:

SEMA4 Records Check (applies to current and past state employees only)
Criminal History Check
Reference Check
Social Security and Address Verification
Education Verification
Other legally required checks

Minnesota IT Services will not sponsor applicants for work visas. All applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States.

Current State Employees

Current State Employees: Please note that employment provisions (including but not limited to seniority and leave accrual) vary among the three branches of Minnesota State government. When considering a job with another branch of state government, you are highly encouraged to explore these differences. For assistance, please direct questions to your current or anticipated Human Resources office.

About Minnesota IT Services

Minnesota IT Services is the information technology agency for the State of Minnesota. MNIT partners with agencies, boards, councils, and commissions to deliver secure, reliable technology solutions as we set IT strategy, direction, policies, and standards statewide. Work for MNIT and be part of a nation-leading IT organization that helps to create an innovative government that works for everyone. Our culture promotes collaboration, demands agility, and encourages us to embrace change. Be a part of something bigger than yourself, something to be inspired by; come to work for MNIT.

Why Work for Us
Diverse Workforce

We are committed to continually developing a workforce that reflects the diversity of our state and the populations we serve. The varied experiences and perspectives of employees strengthen the work we do together and our ability to best serve the people of Minnesota.

A recent engagement survey of State of Minnesota employees found:

95% of employees understand how their work helps achieve their agency’s mission
91% of employees feel trusted to do their jobs
88% of employees feel equipped to look at situations from other cultural perspectives when doing their job
87% of employees report flexibility in their work schedule
Comprehensive Benefits

Our benefits aim to balance four key elements that make life and work meaningful: health and wellness, financial well-being, professional development, and work/life harmony. As an employee, your benefits may include:

Public pension plan
Training and professional development
Paid vacation and sick leave
12 paid holidays each year
Paid parental leave
Low-cost medical and dental coverage
Prescription drug coverage
Vision coverage
Wellness programs and resources
Employer paid life insurance
Short-term and long-term disability
Health care spending and savings accounts
Dependent care spending account
Tax-deferred compensation
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Tuition reimbursement
Federal Public Service Student Loan Forgiveness Program

Programs, resources and benefits eligibility varies based on type of employment, agency, funding availability, union/collective bargaining agreement, location, and length of service with the State of Minnesota.

AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Minnesota state agencies are equal opportunity, affirmative action, and veteran-friendly employers. The State of Minnesota recognizes that a diverse workforce is essential and strongly encourages qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans to apply.

We will make reasonable accommodations to all qualified applicants with disabilities. If you are an individual with a disability who needs assistance or cannot access the online job application system, please contact the job information line at 651-259-3637 or email careers@state.mn.us and indicate what assistance is needed.

Company Name: Girl Scouts of Minnesota and Wisconsin River Valley
Job Description:
Starting in low $50,000's

GSRV Has Excellent Benefits!




Job Summary

The Research and Evaluation Analyst has primary responsibility for developing, analyzing, distributing and maintaining reporting and data analysis across functional areas to provide insight into performance and make recommendations in support of key tactical and strategic decisions.




The Research and Evaluation Analyst is responsible for developing, and managing the organization’s research and evaluation to assess and track performance of programs and initiatives. This position will drive system requirements; document and maintain evaluation processes for assigned systems; and implement, maintain, and support business software applications. By collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data across all operations functions, the Research and Evaluation Analyst demonstrates the measurable impact of programs and informs the implementation of future funding, including Development for fundraising, and initiatives.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities




Manage the organization’s research and evaluation strategy. Independently design, manage, conduct, and analyze internal and external research and evaluation on behalf of the council and in support of the organization’s strategic plan, action plan, and membership goals. Serve as the council’s lead evaluation subject matter expert developing and maintaining relationships with funders, program partners, GSUSA, the Girl Scout Research Institute.
Work with business owners to identify, document, and maintain research and evaluation processes. Establish, develop and report on key analytics relevant to membership, fund development, retail, girl program, product sales, and other areas as identified. Proactively engage, consult and collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business challenges; support goal achievement by providing key metrics to inform decision-making.
Facilitate data-driven, fact-based decision making by analyzing and disseminating key findings, ensuring data is reliable and actionable.
Design, manage, conduct and analyze primary as well as secondary research, demographic and trend data, longitudinal data, and data collection measurement tools. Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis and visualize data. Maintain repository all of outcomes and develop, manage, and deliver regular reports to staff to communicate impact, identify continuous improvement, and build evaluation capacity.
Independently develop, manage, and deliver presentations to Executive Leadership Team, various staff committees, and staff teams on research and evaluation findings and current trends related to program development and outcome achievement to inform and influence data-driven organizational strategies, initiatives, and work plans and to assure high quality experience for girls.
Conduct entire research and evaluation lifecycle through an equity lens.
Maintain data files and databases and monitors the system configurations to ensure data integrity. Design and maintain periodic and ad-hoc reports as needed. Design, distribute and operationalize recurring performance reporting as well as improve the effectiveness and accuracy of reporting and forecasting tools/models.



Additional Duties and Responsibilities




Collaborate with colleagues across operations functions, as well as partners across the council. Actively participate in All Staff meetings, staff in-service training, and other meetings.
When representing the council to both internal and external audiences, articulate GSRV’s desired image and position to all audiences.
Support the council’s commitment to diversity of girls, volunteers, and staff and conduct all activities with a high degree of cultural competency.
Contribute to building a cohesive, flexible, and productive staff environment that demonstrates the values and mission of Girl Scouts and delivers high-quality customer service.
Subscribe to the principles of the Girl Scout Movement.
Become a registered member of GSUSA.



Qualifications

Education and Experience




Required:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Data Analysis, Business Administration or similar.
Minimum 3 years of data analysis, non-profit experience including responsibility for: youth program development; program outcomes evaluation; fiscal/grant management; volunteer management; or a combination of equivalent experience and training.
Demonstrated experience using software applications to manipulate and analyze data, including Qualtrics (survey creation) and Excel (data analysis).



Preferred:

Professional experience in survey design, data research and/or program outcomes evaluation.
Knowledge and experience with Youth Program Quality Assessment (YPQA) process and reporting.
Profiency using ArcGIS software.
Experience writing, conducting and analyzing data and evaluation tools for BIPOC populations.



Knowledge and Skills

Strong business orientation; ability to grasp complex strategic issues and identify high-impact analysis to address the issues.
Demonstrated ability to synthesize and distill the results of complex analyses and communicate to non-technical constituents.
Strong organizational skills with an ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
Proven oral and written communication abilities (i.e. verbal, written, in person and/or over the telephone); demonstrated ability to work with a wide range of sensitive and confidential issues and communicate effectively with a diverse group of girls, volunteers, and staff.
Ability to coordinate multiple projects while managing conflicting priorities and deadlines.
A self-starter who can work independently with minimal oversight and takes initiative; is flexible, adaptable, self-manager, organized, and has a strong attention to detail; thrives in fast-paced, change-oriented environment. Excellent independent decision-making skills and strong resourcefulness.
Ability to foster and maintain strong interdepartmental relationships to motivate and accomplish work through others.
Proficient in MS Office: Word, Power Point, Outlook, with advanced proficiency in Excel.
Ability to work a flexible schedule, including some evenings and weekends as required by position responsibilities.



In addition to job-specific knowledge and skills, all employees are expected to be:




Customer-focused
Aligned
Accountable
Inclusive
Innovative
Collaborative



Don't meet every requirement? Studies have shown that women and BIPOC professionals are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Girl Scouts River Valleys, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you are excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly, we encourage you to apply. You might just be the right candidate for this or other roles.




Girl Scouts River Valleys is committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, access, and racial justice, and is working to boldly lead as an anti-racist organization that uplifts and empowers every Girl Scout to know their worth and lead in their world. This means leading not just with words, but with actions.

Business Intelligence Analyst - Semantic Layer

Hormel Foods Corporation

ABOUT HORMEL FOODS - Inspired People. Inspired Food.™

Hormel Foods Corporation, based in Austin, Minn., is a global branded food company with over $12 billion in annual revenue across more than 80 countries worldwide. Its brands include Planters®, SKIPPY®, SPAM®, Hormel® Natural Choice®, Applegate®, Justin's®, Wholly®, Hormel® Black Label®, Columbus® and more than 30 other beloved brands. The company is a member of the S&P 500 Index and the S&P 500 Dividend Aristocrats, was named on the "Global 2000 World's Best Employers" list by Forbes magazine for three years, is one of Fortune magazine's most admired companies, has appeared on Corporate Responsibility Magazine's "The 100 Best Corporate Citizens" list for 12 years, and has received numerous other awards and accolades for its corporate responsibility and community service efforts. The company lives by its purpose statement - Inspired People. Inspired Food.™ - to bring some of the world's most trusted and iconic brands to tables across the globe. For more information, visit www.hormelfoods.com and http://csr.hormelfoods.com/.

Summary:
We are looking for a Staff Business Intelligence Analyst or Business Intelligence Analyst within our IT Analytics team to design and build our semantics and data virtualization layer for our enterprise data platform. This is an exciting opportunity to modernize our enterprise data platform by enabling a standard, interconnected semantic layer for our business areas across Hormel Foods! Individuals interested in this position will need strong skills in data modeling, communication, business understanding and requirements gathering. You will be responsible for creating and maintaining the semantic layer and data virtualization tool to ensure our end users have an accurate, connected and consistent self-service layer to consume data from.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Requirements gathering, designing, developing, and testing the logical layer using semantics layer tools. Perform issue resolution and maintenance for existing and new logical layers. Focus on understanding the organization's business processes to create the optimal logical layer to support the enterprise for a long-term data analytics foundation. Give training to end users and write technical and functional documentation.

The person in this position will:

Create and maintain the semantic layer, defining business rules, and ensuring data accessibility and accuracy for end-users.
Recommend underlying data models and structures that support the semantic layer.
Govern consistency and create standards for the semantic layer and enforce adherence when standards are not followed.
Create a logical layer that abstracts the complexities of the underlying data sources, such as databases or data warehouses.
Develop data models and structures that translate raw data into business-friendly concepts.
Translate complex SQL queries or technical data terminology into business terms and concepts.
Develop and maintain business rules and calculations to facilitate reporting and analysis.
Document metadata, data definitions, and data lineage to provide context for users.
Set up user access and security permissions to control who can access and modify the semantic layer.
Define roles and permissions for different user groups.
Ensure metadata is accurate and up to date.
Collaborate with data engineers, data architects, business analysts, and other stakeholders to align the semantic layer with business objectives.
Monitor the performance of the semantic layer and optimize it to ensure queries and data retrieval are efficient.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Level of position offered (Staff BI Analyst or BI Analyst) will be determined based on the candidates experience and skill set.

Required:

Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Information Systems, Data Analytics, Physics, Statistics, Math, Engineering, Data Science, or related field.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
3+ years of experience with reading and writing SQL.
3+ years of experience designing and developing within a semantic layer or data virtualization tool like Oracle Business Intelligence Metadata Repository (RPD), Denodo, AtScale, Dremio, or others similar.
Experience understanding and designing business rules and data access security rules.
Proven ability to gather detailed technical requirements to design and develop semantic layer from beginning to end.
Experience understanding and developing or designing dimensional data models in a data warehouse or lake.
Experience leading meetings, groups of people or overseeing processes to achieve established goals.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Tested problem-solving and decision-making skills.
A strong pattern of initiative.
Highly developed interpersonal and leadership skills.
Must be a Citizen or National of the United States, a lawful, permanent resident, or have authorization to work in the United States.
Applicants must not now, or in the future, require sponsorship for an employment visa.

Preferred:

Prior experience with designing and developing a data warehouse or lake in Google BigQuery
Prior experience with performance tuning through data virtualization in a multi-cloud, federated query environment.
Prior experience working with and using Data Governance tools like data.world, Collibra, Informatica Data Governance
Prior experience working with Master Data Management practices and systems

LOCATION:

Austin, Minnesota preferred. Additional location options include Minneapolis, MN, Bentonville, AR, Naperville, IL, Bridgewater, NJ, or Willmar, MN.

A comprehensive relocation package to the Austin, MN area will be provided if willing to relocate.

BENEFITS:

Hormel Foods offers an excellent benefits package. Competitive base salary plus bonus, annual merit increase performance reviews, medical, dental, vision, non-contributory pension, profit sharing, 401(k), stock purchase plan, relocation assistance, paid vacation.

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS: Travel may be necessary 10% of the time.

For immediate consideration, send apply online at: www.hormelfoods.com/careers

At Hormel we invite difference and diversity in all aspects. We offer a space of support, understanding, and community. We are committed to the journey! Learn more about our progress here: https://www.hormelfoods.com/about/diversity-and-inclusion/

Support RiverSource Data Program with business decision-making by providing financial or statistical analysis that lead to recommended solutions for business issues as appropriate. Provide project support from design through implementation and monitoring. Be the liaison between the business, utility functions, and at times external parties to accomplish business objectives. Ensure adherence to data and model governance standards that are set and enforced by industry enterprise and business unit data governance polices and leaders.

Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with business leaders and/or analysts to provide analytical thought leadership and support for business problems.

Identify and interpret business needs, define high-level business requirements, strategy, technical risks, and scope.

Develop, document, and communicate business-driven analytic solutions and capabilities, translating modeling and analytic output into understandable and actionable concrete business knowledge.

Use data from a variety of sources to analyze complex business issues, incorporating company and industry knowledge, mathematical and technological expertise, and sound analytical processes.

Identify issues and/or recommend actions by using statistical analysis, modeling, & other quantitative techniques.

Manage multiple relationships across the organization. Be the main point of contact to answer questions within the business area of expertise.

Act as a liaison among the business and utility functions to gather information and share best practices, and to ensure initiatives are executed appropriately.

Gather data requirements from stakeholders/stewards to lead the development of business glossaries, reference data repository, and facilitate the collection of metadata attributes for critical data assets.

Manage the compliance of Governance policies and procedures. Understand all applicable regulatory requirements and be primary contact for audits or requests for data.

Facilitate the process for data access requests for and ensure timely review and decisioning based on defined policies.

Make recommendations that best meet client and business objectives by knowledge sharing to increase efficiencies and encourage a culture of continuous improvement.


Required Qualifications

Bachelors degree or equivalent

5+ years of experience

Strong analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills and ability to use statistical analysis and modeling, with associated technology applications.

Strong relationship and communication skills in working with colleagues and influencing customers on recommendations and analysis.

In-depth knowledge of business operations and processes with ability to articulate these processes to others

Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)


Preferred Qualifications

Knowledge of Python and hands-on experience of SQL programming languages

Knowledge of PowerApps (Power Business Intelligence (BI) and forms)

In-depth knowledge of Insurance and Annuities business operations and processes with ability to articulate these processes to others

About Our Company
We’re a diversified financial services leader with more than $1 trillion in assets under management and administration. Our team of 20,000 people in more than 20 countries advise, manage and protect the assets and income of more than 2 million individual, small business and institutional clients. We are a long-standing leader in financial planning and advice, a global asset manager and an insurer. Our unwavering focus on our clients and strong financial foundation connects each of our unique businesses - Ameriprise Financial Services, Columbia Threadneedle Investments and RiverSource Insurance and Annuities. POSITION SUMMARY

Hyperautomation is a term that describes the use of multiple technologies to automate end-to-end business processes. Hyperautomation includes technologies such as robotic process automation (RPA), intelligent document processing (IDP), artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and Microsoft’s Power Platform. These technologies, used in conjunction, allow us to simplify tasks, enhance efficiency, and reduce errors by harnessing the power of automation. They handle repetitive work and simplify complex tasks, making our operations smoother and more reliable.

A Business Analyst (BA) – Hyperautomation, is responsible for working with the business to identify business processes that can be automated and developing solutions that leverage hyperautomation tools. The BA is working closely with the developers, project managers, and other stakeholders to ensure successful project delivery. Strong analytical and communication skills, as well as a process driven mindset are essential.

WHY Würth:

Health, Vision and Dental Benefits for Full-time Employees & their Families!
Paid Time Off – start accruing on day one!
Paid Holidays
401(K) with Company Match
Free Life Insurance
Partner Discounts (Ford, Verizon, Harley Davidson and more!)



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify and prioritize hyperautomation opportunities Evaluate business processes and find areas where hyperautomation can enhance efficiency and accuracy
Prepare comprehensive Process Design Documents (PDD) which build the baseline for development
Develop detailed business requirements and use cases for hyperautomation solutions
Work with developers to ensure that solutions are delivered on time and meet business requirements
Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) and provide feedback to developers
Assist with the deployment of hyperautomation solutions and provide support to end-users
Develop and maintain documentation related to hyperautomation solutions
Other duties as assigned.



EDUCATION, QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS & ABILITIES:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or related field preferred
2+ years of experience as a Business Analyst preferred.
Experience with hyperautomation tools such as OCR, RPA, AI, ML, and Power Automate and Power Apps preferred.
Curious about new and innovative technologies
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office Products
Strong attention to detail
Ability to organize and manage workload to meet deadlines.

The Workforce Planning Analyst reports to the Director of HR Analytics and is responsible for overseeing Ecolab’s global workforce, partner closely with HR and Finance team for the different businesses to evaluate business needs and create workforce plan and forecast to fit their need. This high visibility role provides a unique opportunity to drive meaningful discussion between HR and Finance teams as well as senior leadership.

What’s in it For You:

Develop strong relationships with Finance teams

Learn about other

Define Workforce Planning processes as well as KPIs to measure workforce productivity, and efficient use of our resources.

What you will do:

Partner with global HR and Finance teams to understand the business needs and opportunities to deliver the workforce planning and labor cost analysis capabilities

Lead planning, reporting, and forecasting processes for workforce and labor costs in a global manufacturing environment within a matrix organization

Drive change management to act as a subject matter expert for Workforce Planning Solution and financial reporting by engaging with HR and Finance Communities for timely and accurate reporting, forecasting, and planning

Network with other customers, experts, and vendor resources to stay informed on industry/product trends for FP&A technologies for Workforce and Labor cost planning and analysis.

Participate in planning, validation, and testing of new releases and service updates from any solution used for Workforce Planning

Deliver standard reporting outputs, typically on a monthly basis

Deliver ad-hoc reporting insights as needed to support HR, Finance (central planning team), as well as Executive leadership needs

Design and implement training programs related to all FP&A technologies for Workforce and Labor costs, encompassing the entire company as well as making sure the cultural change management is in place for new processes and procedures related to the systems.

Provide technical content as needed for education materials, communication and/or training sessions.

Lead and work in significant detail when required to deliver on commitments

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in business or related topic, or demonstrable experience in workforce planning or workforce management

5 years of experience in an analytical role or 2 years of experience in workforce planning or Workforce management

Ability to meet tight deadlines with focus on quality, results, and timely delivery

Ability to work independently, effectively manage several competing priorities at a time, and flexible to changing priorities

Experience operating in a matrix environment taking work direction outside the main manager lines at times

Ability to analyze data.

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Strong Interpersonal skills

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in business administration, human resources, mathematics, statistics

Experience in workforce planning and/or workforce management

Knowledge of statistical analysis and data modeling

Able to work with all levels of the organization

Ability to develop creative solutions

Ability to provide clarity of complex/abstract concepts

Job Profile Summary: Under supervision, this position consults with internal customers to analyze, design, develop and maintain the technical application systems to support business needs. Responsible for translating business requirements into technical system specifications for teams within the Information Technology (IT) department. Consult with end users on how to effectively use functionality. May make recommendations to management on process improvement, new processes tools and techniques or services. Provide on-going support to end users.
Job Description:




Principle Responsibilities

Analysis and documentation
Identify and define business, functional and interface requirements.
Process new service requests from the analysis and definition of customer requirements through intake, approvals, service delivery, implementation and fulfillment.
Analyze and provide solutions or recommendations to resolve basic customer inquiries for functionality not working as implemented.
Construct workflow charts and diagrams.
Validate resource requirements, develop cost estimate models and gain sign-off from stakeholder.
Manage simple requirement conflicts, and escalate complex requirement conflicts to senior level analysts.
Communicate to internal IT providers of hardware, software and network requirements. Partner with senior analyst if negotiation is needed.
Implement, modify, test, and administer business system applications under minimal supervision.
Improve current systems by studying practices and designing modifications.
Customer management and support
Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
Implement, tests, and deploy solutions to business problems.
Follow incident, change and release management processes.
May be required to provide on-call support outside of regular business hours.
Project management
Under supervision, manage small projects by developing project plans and monitoring performance.
Participate on larger project teams as needed.
Prioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
Other duties as assigned.


Job Requirements

Must be 18 years of age with education and/or experience needed to meet required functional competencies as listed on the job description, and High school diploma or GED preferred
Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science or related field preferred
0 to 2 years experience in information technology, business analysis or related field required

Lifting weight Up to 10 lbs. occasionally, negligible weight frequently

Ability to work well under pressure, successfully navigate ambiguity, and succeed in a rapidly changing, fast-paced, often unpredictable environment with multiple competing priorities.

Job Title: Business Analyst - Stress Testing National Program
Job Description:
Company
Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis
The Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis is seeking a business support professional with a technical aptitude to fill a business analyst position in the Operations Group of the Stress Testing National Program. In this role, the business analyst will help implement and integrate information security and technology into business processes such as access management and provisioning, information security compliance, on/off-boarding staff, product management, robotic process automation, security review analysis and assessment, and more. The preferred candidate will also have experience maintaining SharePoint sites, developing SharePoint workflows, developing Tableau dashboards, and working with Office365 Power Platform tools.

The Stress Testing Program assesses whether U.S. bank holding companies (BHCs), covered savings and loan holding companies (SLHCs), and intermediate holding companies of foreign banking organizations (IHCs) with $100 billion or more in assets (together, referred to as “large banks”) are sufficiently capitalized to absorb losses and continue lending to households and businesses under stressful conditions. The stress tests evaluate the resilience of large banks by estimating their losses, revenues, expenses and resulting capital levels—which provide a cushion against losses—under hypothetical recession scenarios into the future.
Essential Functions
Plays a critical role as a security liaison to on/off-board staff, provision user access, and complete various compliance activities (e.g., system reviews, user access reviews, etc.)
Collaborates closely with internal stakeholders and coordinates with Board of Governors Information Security, FRB Minneapolis Information Security and National IT to successfully complete various deliverables and assist with compliance efforts.
Provides support for SharePoint Online and other O365 applications. May assist in formulating and defining low-code/no-code computer systems scope and objectives through research and analysis of the department business systems and industry requirements.
Responds to requests for information surrounding topics highlighted above; assists with troubleshooting technical problems and issues.
Provides analytic and project support for business planning, strategic local and system initiatives, and technical oriented efforts.
Creates and revises operating procedures; defines processes and delivers training to users.
Exhibits effective problem-solving and communication stills.
Performs other duties or responsibilities as needed or assigned.
Education/Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of higher education and/or experience.
Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, or related field, preferred.
For BA Level II: minimum of 4 years’ experience in a business analytics and/or information technology environment, or equivalent combination of related higher education and experience preferred.
For BA Level III: minimum of 6 years’ experience in a business analytics and/or information technology environment, or equivalent combination of related higher education and experience preferred.

The purpose of your role as a Human Capital Data Analyst

As a Human Capital Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting human capital-related data to provide insights, support strategic initiatives, and enhance Human Capital operations. Partnering closely with leaders, this role will directly influence Human Capital and business decisions by performing research and analysis on a broad range of initiatives.

This role can be performed in-office, fully remote, or hybrid. Ability to work in-office or hybrid from our St. Paul, MN office preferred.

Data Collection and Management

Efficiently and accurately integrate new hires into the Human Capital Management System, ensuring a smooth transition into the organization.
Collect and maintain accurate Human Capital data, including employee information, payroll, benefits, performance, and other relevant data.
Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and security, adhering to data privacy regulations.
Collaborate with Human Capital team members and business/division leaders to gather data requirements and address data-related inquiries.
Collaborate with the HC Operations Manager to design and implement Human Capital systems and processes.
Assesses, tests, and evaluates software upgrade options to determine efficiency, reliability, and compatibility with existing systems.
Develops procedures and drafts necessary guidance & training documentation for installation, use, and troubleshooting of Human Capital software.

Data Analysis and Reporting

Analyze Human Capital data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Create regular reports, dashboards, and ad-hoc analyses to support Human Capital decision-making and strategic planning.
Partner with Human Capital team members to develop reports for all Human Capital & compliance reporting (e.g., EEO Reporting, ACA reporting).
Write, maintain, and support a variety of queries utilizing Human Capital reporting tools. Develop standard reports for ongoing supporting needs.
Research and set up end-user management dashboards.
Proactively partner with team members to understand pain points, inefficient processes and/or obstacles to developing efficient processes. Research and recommend solutions to create capacity on the team while ensuring end-users also experience efficiencies.

Metrics and KPI Tracking

In collaboration with Human Capital team members, define and track Human Capital metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the effectiveness of programs and initiatives.
Provide recommendations based on data analysis to improve processes and outcomes.

Data Visualization

Create visual representations of data to make complex information more accessible and understandable for stakeholders.
Utilize data visualization tools to enhance reporting.

Compliance and Data Security

Ensure data privacy and security compliance, following relevant regulations.
Collaborate with legal and compliance teams to implement data protection policies.
Partner with technology teams to ensure data integrity and optimize Human Capital technology.
Perform periotic data audit to ensure the integrity of data.

What we're looking for in you

Bachelor’s degree in human resources, business, or related
1+ year of proven experience in data analysis, particularly in an HR or business context
Proficiency in data analytics and reporting tools (e.g., Excel, Power BI)
Strong computer literacy required with advanced skills in Microsoft Excel: Pivot tables, VLOOKUP, and other advanced Excel functions and formulas
Strong analytic, problem-solving, troubleshooting, and consultancy skills
Critical thinker with exceptional ability to model system workflows and processes and identify and resolve gaps
Strong aptitude for learning new software and the flexibility to adapt to diverse system environments
UKG and Smartsheet previous experience a plus
Must be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.

The Contractor must provide professional acquisition management support to client program offices. Requirements Documentation

Support the program office in identifying the requirement details. Pre-Solicitation Documentation

Graco manufactures and markets premium equipment to move, measure, control, dispense and spray a wide variety of fluid and powder materials. What does that mean? Well, we pump peanut butter into your jar, and the oil in your car. We glue the soles of your shoes, the glass in your windows and the screen on your phone. We spray the finish on your vehicle, coatings on your pills, the paint on your house and texture on your walls. Graco is part of your daily life.
Job Purpose
The EDI Analyst is responsible for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) systems and processing at Graco. The EDI Analyst’s role is to develop, coordinate, implement, and communicate the organization’s initiatives for EDI systems that exist in the context of an Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) ERP system. The EDI Analyst will act as a liaison between business users, the Oracle EBS technical team, and trading partners to deliver cost-effective, high-quality electronic exchange of information.
*We are open to hire are all levels - Associate, Intermediate or Senior*
Essential Duties
Coordinate with business application and database administration functions to ensure availability and reliability of EDI systems to meet business demands.
Perform system configuration, mapping, and management for EDI-based transactions and processes.
Develop, enhance, and maintain EDI maps for both inbound and outbound transactions.
Work closely with trading partners to plan, execute, and implement data exchanges to benefit both parties.
Troubleshoot and resolve EDI issues.
Develop and maintain project and system documentation per standard.
Perform typical business analyst duties such as requirements gathering, solution design, development, and testing to meet EDI business needs.
Monitor new technologies, techniques, and tools in the EDI space to continue to enhance EDI systems.
Assist with the development of test plans and execution of those plans in conjunction with internal and external personnel.
Develop and conduct end-user training for EDI systems.
Drive the adoption of standard work processes, standard application functionality, and data standards, as well as alignment with global corporate policies and IS methodology.
Acquire and improve skills in EDI and Oracle applications through education and professional organizations.
Promote teamwork and volunteer to serve on ad hoc task groups from time to time
Consult with IS staff on business and technical issues.
Provide guidance and mentorship for employees in the role of EDI Analyst I.
Other duties as assigned
Position Requirements
Essential:
University degree in Business, MIS, or related field (or equivalent).
3 years or more EDI work experience.
Experience installing, configuring, and maintaining EDI systems.
Knowledge of EDI standard formats (ANSI X12, EDIFACT, etc.) and EDI translators.
Demonstrable experience using data translation technologies (e.g. Gentran).
Highly motivated self-starter.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Schedule/deadline oriented.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with end-users and co-workers.
Desirable:
EDI experience in an Oracle E-Business Suite environment.
SQL knowledge.
Oracle API/interface knowledge.
#LI-DS1

Job Description

Business Intelligence Analyst
Position location is flexible and may office from any branch in the USA
Full-time Shift(s): MON TUE WED THU FRI 7:00am - 5:00pm

OVERVIEW:
Working as Full-time Business Intelligence Analyst, you will work closely with our Sales and Business Leaders in providing guidance around reporting, contract pricing models, profit optimization, ROA forecasting, cost savings, and other critical KPIs.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
The duties and responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:
o Analyzing sales and industry related data across Fastenal's contract business segments
o Developing and maintaining optimal pricing models for large contracts
o Identifying wallet-share opportunity and penetration mapping
o Creating reports and data visualizations to support decision and strategy
o Generating ROA forecasting across a book of accounts
o Identifying areas for cost savings and margin improvement
o Providing business intelligence relevant to customer retention

REQUIRED POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:
The following skills and qualifications are required for this position:
o Possess a bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Business Intelligence, Business Administration, MIS, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field of study OR have at least 4 years of work experience in sales, supply chain, or a related business field
o Excellent written and oral communication skills
o Proficient using Microsoft Office Suite
o Highly motivated and self directed with the ability to motivate others
o Demonstrate strong organization, planning and prioritizing abilities
o Exhibit strong problem solving, deductive reasoning and decision making skills
o Demonstrate strong math aptitude, attention to detail and sense of urgency
o Willingness to travel up one week per quarter, when necessary
o Demonstrate our core values of ambition, innovation, integrity and teamwork
o Pass the required drug screen (applicable in the US, Puerto Rico and Guam ONLY)

PREFERRED POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:
o Possess 1-2 years of relevant work, internship, or project related experience in addition to position requirements
o Prior experience using analysis and visualization tools such as: Microsoft Power BI, R Studio, SAS JMP, Tableau, and Power Pivots
o Previous work experience in supply chain management in a related industry with an understanding of MRO and OEM customer segments

ABOUT US:
Since 1967 Fastenal has grown as a distributor of industrial and construction supplies from a single branch to a Fortune 500 company with over 3,000 servicing locations, each providing tailored local inventory and personal service for our customers. As we've expanded across the world, we've retained a core belief in people and their ability to accomplish remarkable things - if given the opportunity. From this philosophy stems an entrepreneurial culture that challenges every employee to run their own business, create their own success, and advance to become company leaders.

As a growth company with a solid financial position, we are committed to training, promoting from within, and creating opportunities for our employees. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and are looking to make your mark as part of an elite growth company, you won't find a better fit than Fastenal.

FULL-TIME BENEFITS:
Fastenal offers a competitive benefits package to all full-time employees. This package includes Health, Life, Long Term Disability, and Dental Insurance, in addition to, paid vacation, sick leave, holidays, and 401(k) with an employer contribution.

Job Title: Debt Management Analyst - State Prog Admin Coordinator
Job Description:
Job Details

Agency: Mn Management & Budget

Division/Unit: Debt Management

Days of Work: Monday - Friday
Travel Required: No

Classified Status: Classified
Bargaining Unit/Union: 214 - MN Assoc of Professional Empl/MAPE
FLSA Status: Exempt - Administrative
Telework Eligible: Yes
Designated in Connect 700 Program for Applicants with Disabilities: Yes
Make a difference in the lives of Minnesotans.

The work you’ll do is more than just a job. Join the talented, engaged and inclusive workforce dedicated to creating a better Minnesota.

Job Summary



Minnesota Management and Budget is looking for a team player to join the Debt Management Division who will contribute to the state's debt management activities.

This position coordinates the administration and review of the state’s bonding program, which includes general obligation, appropriation and revenue bonds, as well as various third party financings and credit enhancement programs. As part of a team, this position collaborates on all preliminary, sale, and closing activities related to the issuance of the state’s debt, including preparation of the official statement and required legal documentation, as well as post-issuance compliance activities and ongoing continuing disclosure. Activities can include establishing bond sale sizing needs, reviewing state bond proceed expenditures, advising on arbitrage rebate calculations and preparing and publishing continuing disclosure material. Third party financings may include the state’s master lease program or other agency equipment financing needs. This position coordinates the establishment and maintenance of the state’s banking contracts, including the request for proposal and selection process. The position also administers various state and federal programs, including state volume cap and credit enhancement programs. Additional responsibilities include conducting additional research or division projects and serving as backup to a similar position in the classification to maintain program continuity when requested.

NOTE: If you are interested in this position, please submit a current resume AND a cover letter describing your qualifications as they relate to the requirements below.




Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
At least four years of professional-level work experience.
Bachelor’s degree in a related field will be substituted for 1 year of required experience.
Advanced degree in a related field will be substituted for 18 months of required experience.

Related degrees: Finance, Accounting, Public Administration, Public Affairs, Public Policy, Mathematics, Business, Law, or Related

Professional-level work experience includes two or more of the following, including at least one in Part A and at least one in Part B:

PART A:

Public finance or public financial management
Financial analysis
Public accounting, business, banking or finance

PART B:

Financial document preparation or review or financial lending experience
Project management or program administration
Business writing or other technical writing experience with financial documents
Risk compliance or audit monitoring

Applicants will also be assessed on the following:

Exceptional analytical and organizational skills and attention to detail
Demonstrated technical skills, including proficiency in Excel, Word and Access, with ability to create, maintain, organize, and manipulate various spreadsheets and databases, and ability to learn new software and systems
Knowledge of technical subject matter area, including associated regulatory requirements
Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills
Proven ability to collaborate and work effectively as part of a team
Commitment to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace
Ability to manage competing priorities while meeting important deadlines
High problem-solving ability that serves and enhances the mission of the organization


Preferred Qualifications
Foundation in public finance principles and practices, including familiarity with municipal debt structures, continuing disclosure obligations through the Electronic Municipal Market Access service, federal regulations particularly related to expenditure and arbitrage monitoring, banking systems, and building financial models
Advanced proficiency in Excel and database software to analyze data
Familiarity with SWIFT (PeopleSoft), the state’s accounting system, or other large public accounting system, including ability to reconcile accounts and understanding of budget practices
Knowledge of state procurement rules and processes
Program expenditure audit experience, including methodology for selecting samples for compliance review
Understanding of continuous improvement methods and commitment to improving services and processes
Additional Requirements

In order to be considered for this position, applicants must include a cover letter along with a resume. Please include a description in your cover letter of your qualifications that meet the requirements listed above. Cover letters may be included in the same file as the resume, or they may be emailed separately to anne.ward@state.mn.us

Minnesota Management and Budget will conduct reference checks to verify job-related credentials and a criminal background check prior to appointment.

Application Details
How to Apply

Select “Apply for Job” at the top of this page. If you have questions about applying for jobs, contact the job information line at 651-259-3637 or email careers@state.mn.us. For additional information about the application process, go to http://www.mn.gov/careers.

If you have questions about the position, contact Anne Ward at anne.ward@state.mn.us or 651-757-1789.

To receive consideration as a Connect 700 Program applicant, apply online, email the Job ID#, the Working Title and your valid Proof of Eligibility Certificate by the closing date to Anne Ward at anne.ward@state.mn.us.

As an Enterprise Analyst – Customer Experience, you will be responsible to analyze data and develop reporting and written summaries for quantitative and qualitative evaluation of our Customer Experience departments’ efforts at UCare. Analytics will support the strategic development and assessment of UCare’s customer experience activities related to utilization management, provider profiling, and program evaluations. You will represent Health Care Economics and the Customer Experience Department in meetings and work groups pertaining to health care analytics, clinical, financial, and strategic initiatives, as assigned. Support the development and compilation of result-driven health care analytics.

Provide data, analysis, and written summaries to support ongoing UCare customer experience strategies. Evaluate organization level initiatives and impacts on key measures including customer satisfaction, customer effort scores and net promoter scores as measured by internal and external surveys.


Maintain an understanding of the correlations between customer retention and demographic, geographic, health status, pharmacy services, etc. Research qualitative analysis and conclusions for effectiveness of initiatives and programs. Assist in the selection and design of evaluation techniques for new initiatives, including the development of baseline and expected effects of new programs and initiatives.


Assist in gathering and identifying key data sources within UCare’s customer service systems, including but not limited to FUSE, telephony systems, etc. Assist in the population and maintenance of UCare data resources, including dental, manual input data sources, and other internal databases; validate data for accuracy. Identify and assist in the development and implementation of solutions to data issues.


Ensure timely and accurate delivery of reporting and analysis to assist in meeting strategic and departmental goals. Design and implement new analysis and reporting to support UCare leadership, with manager support.
