About Children’s Minnesota

Children’s Minnesota is one of the largest pediatric health systems in the United States and the only health system in Minnesota to provide care exclusively to children, from before birth through young adulthood. The Business Transformation Analyst will support functional leads across our Shared Success Center, in documenting and operationalizing regional support models. Support other initiatives within business transformation as directed.

Develop data-driven solutions to complex business problems.
Articulate complex and technical language with non-technical audiences in a manner that is clear, concise, and value added to these audiences.

The Omnichannel Quality Analyst is integral to the success of Capella University’s ability to reach its applicants and learners with personalized, engaging, high-standards communications across email, text, automated voicemails, mobile notifications and other channels. This key role is responsible for monitoring, recommending, and implementing preventative and corrective processes, monitors, alerts and other actions to ensure that our automated communications meet Capella’s quality standards.

The Omnichannel Quality Analyst will review the volume of outbound communications daily to identify and resolve issues requiring attention. This position will work with reporting teams to identify alerts and reports that will improve our ability to quickly identify and resolve production issues.

This position will be responsible for collaborating with the Omnichannel Innovation team to inspect and review new and modified journeys to maintain Capella’s quality standards. The Omnichannel Quality Analyst will work within the team to identify new standards of operation that will ensure consistent building and operational guidelines.

Please note that preference will be given to applicants who are in a commutable distance to our office in Minneapolis, MN.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Ensure every journey launch meets quality standards by validating journey population, canvas design and inspecting journey configurations prior to launch.
Monitor quality of automated outbound communications (email, text, voicemails) through audits, production support and daily review of activity.
Partner with Information Technology (IT) resources to document, assess and improve the stability and predictability of source data systems and the integration services that power communication journeys.
Partner with internal resources, including the Planning and Reporting Team, to continually improve visibility of expected communications by creation of dashboards and alerts.
Recommend and implement changes to existing journeys to improve quality and journey results.
Run daily huddle review of communications sent/expected to send.
Responsible for planning, refining, executing and tracking a process to proactively and regularly review all omnichannel communications, ensuring all messages are reviewed with appropriate frequency and depth each year.
Assist in creation of job aids to ensure Omni resources are consistently executing processes.
Recommend job aids, templates or other processes to ensure automated communications consistently meet Capella standards.
Work inquiries from internal partners to answer questions and make recommendations for potential changes to existing journeys.

Ability to analyze data and provide recommendations based on data.

Strong computer skills (proficient in Excel, comfortable and adept working with data, knowledge of text/email service providers such as Salesforce and Eloqua, and familiar with customer relationship management such as PeopleSoft and Salesforce). Experience with PowerPoint preferred.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work on multiple projects under strict deadlines.
Highly adaptable to the growing and changing needs of the business.

2-3 years experience in executing communication campaigns, providing data collection/analysis or reporting.
Experience working in a cross-functional environment.

The Data & Analytics Lead drives Patterson’s data-driven culture by empowering users to effectively leverage data as part of their decision-making process. This position will understand the business process and relevant data flows associated with that process, understand the capabilities of different data platforms and reporting / analytics tools, and match business needs with the relevant data and tools. This role may train a user on the relevant data or tool set for the user to answer their own business question (self-service), brainstorm an ad-hoc solution with the user and source the data for the user via advanced query tools or methods, or promote the request to a Data & Analytics enhancement or project, to create a standard process or report that multiple users can utilize once move to a production environment. This role will also complete ad hoc analysis based on requests from senior leadership. This role is synonymous with IT Data Product Owner.

Major Duties

Lead Data & Analytics collaborator with a set of Patterson departments (ex: Marketing or Supply Chain), ensuring business partners can access and use data for effective decision-making.

Assess business needs against current data and analytics solutions

Identify data and analytics gaps, brainstorm solutions and maintained prioritized backlog

Ensure user engagement and adoption with training materials and events for data and analytics end users

Perform ad hoc analysis when needed, including data mining and cleansing, and completing data analysis using any available analytics tool set

Develop or productionize data and analytics solutions

Manage larger data and analytics projects, including projects that require coordination with development from transactional systems and projects that span multiple business processes; ensure projects are completed on time and on budget.

May have day-to-day work assignment responsibilities for small team of data development and report/analytics development resources, including but not limited to maintaining and grooming work backlog, assigning backlog to team members, and communicating status of backlog items and deployments to end users

Capture feedback from users via demos, workshops or brainstorming sessions. Anticipate problems or needs and address them.

Minimal travel in US, Canada & UK (<10% of time)

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree

Preferred focus - Data & Analytics, Computer Science, Business

5+ years progressive experience in collaborating with business partners and delivering actionable data and insights that drive business value

Development experience in common reporting and analytics tools (SAP BusinessObjects, Microstrategy, PowerBI, etc…)

Demonstrated ability to learn new business processes, data and analytics tools

Self-starter with a high degree of motivation to learn and go above and beyond to help business partners and team succeed.

Exceptional problem solving, analytical, data visualization, project management, logical reasoning skills

Ability to clearly communicate ideas and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences, including senior leadership

Preferred Qualifications:

Development experience with SAP (BOBJ, BW, HANA), Microsoft (Azure, Power BI), MicroStrategy, Informatica

SQL querying and modeling skills

Background in Distribution, Logistics, Inventory Management or Supply Chain Operations

Experience with Agile methodologies, especially Kanban

Experience as a Product Owner

Locations: Patterson Corporate States

Department/Location: Information Technology / 1001 Washington Ave N

Summary

The primary purpose of this position is responsibility for assisting with the planning, development, training/adoption and maintenance/support of the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system and business process. The incumbent customizes and configures the applications, workflow and business process to allow the integration of applications to support the needs of the Agency. The incumbent also works on complex ERP projects, develops efficient/effective processes and ensures client needs are met through project management and analysis.

All activities must support the Minneapolis Public Housing Authority’s ('MPHA' or 'Agency') mission, vision and values.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

The position duties and responsibilities listed below describe the general nature and scope of work. Other responsibilities, duties and skills may be required and assigned, as needed.

Manages, develops and maintains the function and technology of the ERP system; maintains partnerships with the ERP and third-party vendors; supports the ERP system daily and involves the vendor support as needed.
Provides regular ERP upgrade planning, support and technical leadership to maintain a current ERP system.
Consults with key stakeholders in a proactive manner to establish project scope and timeline.
Develops detailed business requirements document (BRD) with input from process owners, subject matter experts (SME), and other stakeholders.
Provide applications design and architectural support on projects work with ERP system SMEs.
Responsible for quality assurance testing of the solution. Ensures that the scope, contract and business requirements are met.
Creates and manages project plans, ensures team accountability of the plan, and is responsible for key project constraints: scope, resources, schedule, budget, quality, risks, and issues.
Establishes communication plans including internal meetings, statuses with key stakeholders, and other communication as required during the project.
Evaluates alternative approaches with key stakeholders with a focus on value.
Elicits regular feedback from Agency stakeholders regarding effectiveness and operation of the ERP system; and makes recommendations for enhancements, improvements and changes.
Collaborates with consultants and vendors to optimize ERP system performance and determines scope/priority of ERP system enhancements as necessary.
Responsible for a 'change control' process throughout the project lifecycle, proactively monitors and controls any change in scope, and elicits approval or resolution of any changes among all internal and external stakeholders.
Develops partnerships to understand process and automation needs of MPHA, and to support department and Agency systems.
Partners with IT team and other MPHA departments to ensure that Agency needs are met through the ERP system. Partners with ERP system vendor to maintain expertise in the ERP system functions and regularly communicates with IT team and required users.
Develops and maintains ERP system and process documentation for MPHA. Responsible for ensuring process and automation adoption for the effective and efficient use of the ERP system to support the mission of MPHA.
Provides and maintains ERP system and process training for MPHA users and ensures capabilities are effectively used.
Performs other related duties as assigned.

Behavioral Competencies

MPHA expects all employees to exhibit the following behavioral skills:

Customer Service: Meets/exceeds the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; identifies, understands, monitors and measures the needs of both internal and external customers; talks and acts with customers in mind; and recognizes working colleagues as customers.

Commitment: Sets high standards of performance; pursues aggressive goals and works hard/smart to achieve them; strives for results and success; conveys a sense of urgency and brings issues to closure; and persists despite obstacles and opposition.

Effective Communication: Employee is prepared, clear, concise and organized in all facets of communication in order to fully establish understanding. Actively listens and understands the audience to adapt message appropriately. Communicates information with appropriate personnel in a timely manner.

Teamwork: Balances team and individual responsibilities; exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; gives and welcomes feedback; contributes to building a positive team spirit; puts success of team above own interests; supports everyone's efforts to succeed.

Initiative: Proactively seeks solutions to resolve unexpected challenges. Actively assists others without formal/informal direction. Possesses the capacity to learn and actively seeks developmental feedback. Applies feedback for continued growth by mastering concepts needed to perform work.

Physical Demands

Position summary


As a Data Analyst, you'll utilize modern BI tools and data platforms to analyze data, trends, and insights, and develop operational, business, and key service analytics for internal business partners. Your focus will be to transform complex data into information which can offer ways to improve our business, impacting business decisions.




This is a fulltime salaried hybrid that will require one to be onsite at least two days per week.



Responsibilities:
Collaborate with the product owner and other internal stakeholders to understand and define the data and analytics requirements for business decision-making.
Analyze, interpret and translate complex data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations for the business owners & leaders.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that effectively visualize key performance indicators and business trends.
Use statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive business analytics.
Support the scrum master in backlog refinement and sprint planning activities by providing insight into data complexities and availability.
Collaborate with the data engineer in the formulation of processes for data extraction, transformation, and load (ETL).
Train end users on dashboard, reports, and the BI Platform.
Actionable Dashboards and Reports: Deliver reports and dashboards that visualize key performance indicators and business trends.
Data Analysis Reports: Provide comprehensive reports summarizing data analysis findings, including actionable insights and recommendations.
Data Insight for Sprint Planning: Provide data insight to support backlog refinement and sprint planning activities.
End User Training: Deliver effective training to end users on dashboards, reports, and the BI platform.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required in analytics, computer science or business administration.
5+ years of experience analyzing data, trends, and creating reports and analytics.
Experience using BI tools and global data platforms (PowerBI, Tableau, etc.).
Experience with best practices for data science, decision science, and business intelligence, including methodologies for ETL (SQL).
Knowledge of database principles and data formats and the ability to use it to organize, process, and analyze data.
Hands-on Experience with Queries, Data relationships, and basic programming.
Fluency in writing DAX Measures and Calculated Columns.
Fluency in Data Preparation, Data Modeling, and Data Visualization.
Microsoft Office experience, including intermediate excel skills.
Exposure to Cloud technology.
Desirable Criteria & Qualifications
Work experience with predictive analytic modeling tools such as R, Python, DataRobot, and Microsoft Azure ML.
Previous experience building Metrics, Balanced Score Cards, Key Performance Indicators, Data Analysis, with dashboard data visualization techniques.
Experience with analyzing data pulled from a data historian for a production environment.
Experience with the medical device industry is a plus.

Job Title: Sr SDoH and Population Insights Data Analyst - Remote
Job Description:
At UnitedHealthcare, we’re simplifying the health care experience, creating healthier communities and removing barriers to quality care. The work you do here impacts the lives of millions of people for the better. Come build the health care system of tomorrow, making it more responsive, affordable and equitable. Ready to make a difference? Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together.




Around here, we're always striving for better. A better way to think. A better way to care. A better way to succeed. As the Sr SDoH and Population Insights Data Analyst, you'll drive the improvements and enhancements of our data model. You’ll partner with team members in IT and offshore. And you’ll be part of making sure our data model is accurate and supportive of regulatory requirements. Not to mention, since UHC is part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, you will also have the support and resources of a Fortune 5 industry leader. It's a chance to be a part of something transformative. Sound good? Join us today.




You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.




Primary Responsibilities:

Onshore lead infrastructure analyst for the UHC Social Determinants of Health platform, responsible for prioritizing and defining work for offshore resources, mentoring them on data knowledge as well as technical skills, reviewing their results, and presenting to SDoH leadership for feedback and approval
Responsible for performing in-depth data analysis on the enterprise data
Responsible for monitoring the data quality and engaging with the stakeholders and reporting team to ensure right enhancements are documented, prioritized and road mapped
Partnering with the data platform scrum team to implement enhancements and ensure quality data is delivered
Functioning as a data SME for the tech team
Conducting and managing outcomes of various studies that include analyzing, reviewing, forecasting, trending, and presenting information for operational and business planning
Supporting short and long term operational/strategic business activities - by developing, enhancing, and maintaining operational information and models
Developing and implementing effective/strategic business solutions through research and analysis of data and business processes
Responsible for creating specifications to bring different data into a common structure, creating product specifications and models, developing data solutions to support analyses, performing analysis, interpreting results, developing actionable insights and presenting recommendations for use across the enterprise
Serves as a key resource on complex and/or critical issues that arise around the SDoH platform



You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications:

4+ years of experience writing code for various SQL applications; such as Oracle, Snowflake, MS SQL, Azure SQL, Hive, etc.
Experience with data modeling and data warehousing
Experience with Medicaid & Medicare including member eligibility and claims data
Experience translating business requirements into capabilities and features
Experience with data analysis and interpreting results
Experience mentoring and partnering with other team members of various grade levels; with ability to motivate and inspire team members
Experience reviewing work performed by others and provides recommendations for improvement
Willing to adjust working hours to accommodate East Coast and offshore business hours as needed



Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with UHC applications (SMART for C&S, GPS for M&R, CMS warehouse, CDB, etc.)
Experience with visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI
Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical issues in the appropriate way for the current audience (technical or business)
Self-reliant, self-driving, curious and a fast learner

California, Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, or Washington Residents Only: The salary range for California/Colorado/Connecticut/Nevada/New Jersey/New York/Rhode Island/Washington residents is $85,000 to $167,300 annually. No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.




At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. Position Overview:

The IT Sr. Business Analyst role is part of Client’s Business Analyst (BA) job family, which is ultimately responsible for delivering and leveraging analytics throughout the solution development lifecycle to ensure the optimal development, implementation, integration, user acceptance, and performance of client’s applications, systems, and processes both within and across business functions. Business Analysts are responsible for identifying business needs, assessing the impact of system or process changes, eliciting and documenting requirements, and providing insight to ensure requirements are translated into workable business solutions. These roles are also responsible for conducting user-acceptance testing and providing post implementation support to business stakeholders and end-users to ensure solutions meet the prescribed business requirements. Responsibilites:

Develops complex requirements, or leads a team of BAs in the development of requirements, for process or system solutions which may span multiple business domains by partnering with stakeholders and appropriate IT teams (e.g., Solutions Delivery, Infrastructure, Enterprise Architecture);
Everaging multiple business requirements gathering methodologies to identify business, functional, and non-functional requirements
Documenting requirements throughout each stage of the project or initiative to ensure trace-ability
Documenting comprehensive business cases to assess the costs, benefits, ROI, and Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) of proposed solutions.
Provides insight and aids in the evolution of applications, systems, and/or processes to a desired future state by maintaining a comprehensive understanding of how current processes impact business operations across multiple domains
Mapping current state against future state processes
Identifying value gaps and opportunities for process enhancements or efficiencies
Defining the impact of requirements on upstream and downstream solution components
Providing insight and influence to management on how to integrate requirements with current systems and business processes
Supports solution design by providing insight at design sessions with IT teams to help translate requirements into workable business solutions; advocating for additional data and/or services as necessary to address key business issues
Researching, vetting, and recommending available third-party vendors to management and business leaders as appropriate
Practices self-leadership and promotes learning in others by building relationships with cross-functional stakeholders
Communicating information and providing advice to drive projects forward; influencing team members within assigned unit
Adapting to competing demands and new responsibilities
Providing feedback to others, including upward feedback to leadership and mentoring junior team members

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience
Strong 8+ years of experience required

Preferred Qualifications:

Master’s Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, CIS or related field
Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA)
Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP)
Demonstrated experience implementing modern ERP solutions
6 years of experience in business case development and analysis
3 years of work experience in a business role requiring interaction with executive leadership
3 years of experience working on cross-functional project teams

To Apply: Please send your update resume to jobs@ibsysinc.com

Business Unit Overview:
Headquartered in Lakeville, Minn., Post Consumer Brands, a business unit of Post Holdings, Inc., is dedicated to providing people and their pets with delicious food choices for every taste and budget. The company’s portfolio includes beloved brands such as Honey Bunches of Oats®, PEBBLES®, Grape-Nuts® and Malt-O-Meal® cereal, and Peter Pan® peanut butter, as well as Rachael Ray® Nutrish®, Kibbles ‘n Bits® and 9Lives® dog and cat food. As a company committed to high standards of quality and to our values, we are driven by one idea: To make lives better by making delicious food accessible for all. For more information about our brands, visit www.postconsumerbrands.com and follow us on LinkedIn for the latest news.
Brand:
Post Consumer Brands recently acquired several iconic pet food brands, venturing into a new market while remaining true to our purpose to provide delicious and accessible food that our consumers love. We’re always searching the center store for the next exciting product to add to our portfolio, and right now, we’re growing and need passionate, driven individuals with diverse perspectives to help us reach greater heights. That’s where you come in. Join a team where your voice is not only heard but valued. Make a real impact on brands enjoyed by millions of people and their pets.
At Post Consumer Brands, we take pride in our longstanding legacy of making one of every five breakfast cereals families eat daily. Today, we’re just as focused on our future as we expand our grocery business with different shelf-stable foods, including snacks and peanut butter. We are committed to providing accessible and delicious food for families, and we’re always searching the center store for the next exciting product to add to our portfolio. As we soar to new heights, we need creative, determined individuals from all walks of life to join our team, where your unique perspective and ideas are acknowledged and valued. Be a part of a company that empowers you to make a difference that’s evident on grocery store shelves and families’ tables across North America.
Location Description:
Post Consumer Brands corporate headquarters in Lakeville, Minn. is about 20 miles south of Minneapolis and St. Paul, Lakeville has all the benefits of smaller town living with access to everything a large metropolitan area has to offer. Join more than 400 team members collaborating on the two-building campus to help put breakfast on the tables of millions of consumers in North America.
Responsibilities:
Post Consumer Brands seeks a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst in Lakeville, MN to hold a highly technical, analytics-focused role that includes interaction and partnership with leaders across the business. The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for conceptualizing, designing, and developing visually compelling business reporting solutions using Tableau dashboards. The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is also responsible for creating and supporting shared data sources in Tableau and related queries/views in Snowflake.

Working Location: Hybrid
This role is located at the Lakeville, MN Corporate office
Typical hybrid schedule includes 3 days in-office with remote flexibility up to 2 days a week.

Duties and Responsibilities:


Communicate and collaborate with business leaders and users to conceptualize and design reporting solutions that drive value and aid in business decision making
Design, build, and validate Tableau dashboards, data sources, and ad-hoc reports
Design, build, and validate Snowflake queries and views
Understand and leverage Tableau best-practices and advanced features to deliver intuitive, accurate, high-impact dashboards
Collaborate with the Data Engineering team to combine data from multiple sources and develop integrated data sources and dashboards
Develop a strong understanding of our enterprise data and source systems
Provide internal consulting to analysts and employees throughout the business
Identify process improvement opportunities and take the initiative to implement those improvements
Perform proactive and reactive Tableau maintenance and support tasks
Create documentation and design artifacts
Provide training on Tableau and the use of data/information to business users
Provide guidance and mentorship to less experienced analysts on topics such as analysis, documentation, industry best practices, efficient modeling of data etc.
Perform ad-hoc duties as needed based on changing business needs
Effectively manage competing priorities and multiple concurrent projects
Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Management, a closely related field, or a foreign equivalent degree
Tableau Data Analyst Certification may be considered in lieu of relevant degree
Four (4)+ years of experience developing dashboards and data sources in Tableau
Four (4)+ years of experience developing SQL queries and views. Snowflake experience is a plus but not required

Key Attributes:

Critical and Strategic Thinking – Ability to evaluate multiple options for designing efficient and effective BI solutions; ability to make informed decisions based on data.
Adaptability – Flexible and adaptable to changing business requirements, evolving technologies, and emerging practices in the field of BI.
Collaboration and Communication – Work well with cross-functional teams including analysts, data engineers, and business stakeholders. Understand business needs and foster a positive team environment.
Leadership – Experience leading BI projects, influencing stakeholders, providing guidance, setting expectations, and mentoring others.
Business Acumen – Demonstrate a strong understanding of the business domain, identify relevant metrics, and deliver meaningful insights. Experience in CPG or Retail is preferred.
Time Management – Effective time management, task prioritization, adherance to deadlines, and timely project delivery.

Job Title: Capital Senior Analyst - Minneapolis or Charlotte
Job Description:
At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

Job Description

U.S. Bank is seeking a highly motivated and detailed-oriented individual to join the Corporate Treasury Capital Management team, which is responsible for managing, forecasting, and reporting the capital adequacy of U.S. Bancorp and its related subsidiaries in normal operating conditions as well as under stress. The stress tests have been designed by the Federal Reserve to assess capital adequacy of financial institutions under different economic stress scenarios. This role will provide support to the Capital Forecast Manager by assisting with the monthly Capital forecast process as well as the annual stress test and corresponding reporting.

Primary Responsibilities

Assist in developing the monthly Capital forecast process and annual Capital stress test

Partner with multiple teams and business lines for financial analysis, capital forecasting, and capital stress testing

Assist with documentation and procedures updates for the annual stress test

Develop and maintain spreadsheets for capital forecasting and financial analysis, in accordance with regulatory requirements

Prepare forecast and variance reporting for all levels of Capital Management

Provide financial analysis related to forecasting and stress test

Develop proforma financial reporting for review by senior management

Ability to analyze data to identify and communicate capital trends

Communication is done both verbally and through creation of various reports to illustrate key information

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience

Five or more years of related experience in Treasury, Finance, or Accounting

Preferred Skills/Experience

Advanced knowledge of financial analysis techniques

Considerable knowledge of forecasting

Strong mathematical, analytical, and data management skills

Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel

Knowledge of Hyperion Essbase is a plus

Process improvement experience with various spreadsheets and reporting

Ability to prioritize deadlines while maintaining a high attention to detail

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Ability to interact effectively with multiple teams and business lines

Knowledge of regulatory requirements is a plus

Tag: INDMO

This role is hybrid from the locations listed (Minneapolis, MN or Charlotte, NC). Team members who are in a hybrid role typically spend three days a week at a U.S. Bank location, while having flexibility on their work location for the other working days.

If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.


Benefits:

Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):

Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)

Basic term and optional term life insurance

Short-term and long-term disability

Pregnancy disability and parental leave

401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan

Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)

Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities

Adoption assistance

Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law

EEO is the Law

U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

E-Verify

U.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services.

The salary range reflects figures based on the primary location, which is listed first. The actual range for the role may differ based on the location of the role. In addition to salary, US Bank offers a comprehensive benefits package, including incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase 401k contribution and pension (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Pay Range: $99,365.00 - $116,900.00 - $128,590.00

Choosing a career with ECMC Group means joining a nonprofit corporation with a mission to help students succeed. With a vibrant mission and values, great benefits, and strong community involvement, ECMC Group companies are an ideal team to join.
Job Summary:
The Senior Business Analyst is the primary liaison between the business and IT, representing the interest of internal and external clients and trading partners, to ensure the business function is effective and supported from a technical perspective. In addition, this candidate will partner with a cross-functional team of experts to design and deliver business reviews that provide valuable insights and influence decision-making.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Works independently with business representatives to fully define the business need and objective for complex and/or strategic initiatives.
Provides advanced business analysis, design, software testing, implementation skills, and influences the outcome of multiple projects including budgeting, execution, implementation, and overall cost.
Performs complex impact assessment of changes to requirements and designs.
Synthesizes complex data from disparate sources to understand the qualitative and quantitative impacts of the business need in the current environment.
Effectively conducts root cause analyses for complex problems using multiple techniques.
Elicits business-related requirements and acceptance criteria as input into IT solutions using relevant elicitation techniques.
Models scope, requirements, and acceptance criteria through matrices, text, and diagrams such as business and/or data process flows and use case narratives.
Recommends testing approach to Quality Assurance partner based on the scope and timelines according to approved standards.
Resolves complex issues or inquiries with minimal assistance or guidance.
Mentors’ junior business analysts as appropriate.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree, or relevant education and experience in lieu of degree
5 years’ of demonstrated work experience performing business analysis activities related to systems enhancements and/or IT solutions
Experience developing business requirements and acceptance criteria within the SDLC lifecycle.
Experience leading cross functional teams, including business and IT teams.
Advanced proficiency in MS Office (PPT, Excel, Word and Visio)
Advanced ability to solve problems, think critically, and analyze information
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Preferred Qualifications:
CCBA (Certification of Capability in Business Analysis) from International Institute of Business Analysis
PMI-PBA (Professional in Business Analysis) from the Project Management Institute (PMI)
Advanced Agile Scrum Training
Experience with Confluence and JIRA
Student Loan industry experience is a plus
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.
Position is in Minneapolis and not eligible for remote.
ECMC Group is committed to ensuring our diverse, inclusive and equitable culture is built on a strong sense of belonging, where everyone feels seen, heard and encouraged to show up as their authentic self.

Job Title: IT Finance Business Analyst BAAN and Infor LN
Job Description:
ANDERSEN CORPORATION SUMMARY:

We’re focused on bringing more light into people’s lives by helping them create healthier, happier spaces to build memories and do what they love. This applies to our team, too. By celebrating our differences and embracing a positive work-life balance, we are recognized as a Yellow Ribbon company, one of Forbes Magazine’s 2021 “America’s Best Large Employers” and a “Best Employer for Diversity.” As a 2021 Energy Star Partner of the Year, Andersen is also committed to environmental health and sustainability. No matter your role, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
SUMMARY:

Andersen Corp is looking for an Finance IT Business Analyst that has a background in Infor ERP tools like BaanERP, Baan IV and Infor LN. The position will include a variety of roles including implementing business improvements, project work and support. The IT Business Analyst is responsible for the planning, development, maintenance, and enhancement of the functional areas of application packages. They are assigned to teams within an assigned business unit and independently utilize various client/server platforms as well as, mentor others. Individuals collaborate with company customers, staff, IT and other stakeholders to identify user requirements, assess available technologies, and recommend solution options. They are proficient in assessing business objectives and design business processes for medium to high level objectives in such a way that they may be effectively modeled, configured and measured within the package application environment. Demonstrated ability to mentor others. Individuals are proficient in communicating the application package capabilities and possibilities to designated functional areas, while seeking ways to collaborate with IT members to facilitate transition to and support of the application package .

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for medium to high level business analysis and process design in one or more functional areas (finance, accounting, invoicing, etc.) within the enterprise in the analysis and redesign of application package functions and processes. Assists less experienced business analysts with design and knowledge transfer Completes comprehensive unit, system and performance testing of application that includes its components and interfaces.
Responsible for definition of application scope and objectives and devise/modify procedures to solve medium to high complexity business problems. Assists less experienced business analysts with problem resolution Adhere to Agile practices and other PMO or Team project methodology
Responsible for communicating application package capabilities/possibilities within one or more functional areas with medium to high complexity of requirements. Assists less experienced business analysts with application package capabilities
Responsible for the specification and validation of reporting universes. Responsible for Specifying, developing, and validating medium to high complexity business reports
Maintain business relationships and integrate activities with other departments to ensure successful implementation and support efforts
Develop and maintain good relationships with customers, IT colleagues, project leads and architects to meet expected customer service levels
May regularly coach other team members.
MUST HAVE QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or related discipline.
Minimum of 3 years of development experience with a variety of leading-edge development languages and platforms, including VB.NET or similar development tool
Understanding of Financial areas/concepts including general ledger, income statements, balance sheets and other financial concepts.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual skills
NICE-TO-HAVE QUALIFICATIONS
Strong verbal and written communication skills, proficient in the ability to express medium to high level technical concepts in business terms
Strong interpersonal skills; ability to work well on cross-functional project teams and foster team commitment to tasks
Developing project management skills, operating as part of a team organizing, planning, and executing projects from vision through implementation
SALARY INFORMATION:
Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to work experience, education, geographic location, certifications, etc. In addition to your pay, Andersen Corporation currently offers benefits such as comprehensive health benefits, 401k contribution, paid time off, 8 paid standard holidays, plus 2 floating holidays, a robust employee Wellbeing program, as well as profit sharing (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
CULTURE AND BENEFITS:
“Be Orange. Be You” is how we express our belief that by embracing our differences and empowering you, we’ll be a stronger team able to accomplish what otherwise wouldn’t be possible. This Orange spirit has helped us become the #1 innovative window and door brand* and the one homeowners love the most.** It’s also why we’re committed to supporting you to approach each day with a bright outlook.
Benefits include, and are not limited to:
Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance
Health Savings Account contributions
Paid holidays plus PTO
401(k) plan & contributions
Professional development and tuition reimbursement opportunities
Charity contributions
Nationwide career opportunities
We look forward to seeing how your unique skills, background and experiences will inspire our team and help us continue to be the leader we are today.
2020 Andersen brand surveys of U.S. contractors, builders & architects
** 2020 Andersen Brand Survey of U.S. homeowners
In 2023, Andersen has set a profit-sharing target of $4,000 per eligible employee, prorated as appropriate. Profit sharing will be paid out in quarterly installments to provide eligible employees with payments throughout the year, with payment amounts tied to quarterly operating profit performance.
Andersen is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, disability, marital status, national origin, citizenship, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Company Introduction:
If you're friendly and dependable and you like to work with terrific guests, we'd love to talk about an opportunity on our team!

Coborn's, Inc. is a fast-growing employee-owned grocery retailer located in the Midwest. Our grocery store formats include Coborn's, Cash Wise, Marketplace Foods, Hornbacher's, Tadych’s Marketplace Foods, and Sullivan’s Foods and we offer unique online grocery home delivery services through our CobornsDelivers and Cash Wise Delivers locations.

Coborn's, Inc. also owns and operates liquor stores under the Coborn's Liquor, Cash Wise Liquor, Andy’s Liquor and Captain Jack's brands. Additionally, our fuel and convenience division, pharmacy, in-house grocery warehouse and distribution center, in-house Central Bakery, in-house Fresh Foods Commissary, and Tops Cleaners are significant assets to our operations. We also have a handful of other retail entities in the markets where the fit is right: Little Dukes, Holiday Stationstores, Ace Hardware, Country Floral Gifts & Greenhouse, Caribou Coffee, Dunn Bros Coffee, Subway and Erbert and Gerbert's.
Overview:

About the Business Analyst:

As a Business Analyst, you drive business efficiencies thru developing and executing system and regression test plans and cases, and establishing quality assurance policies in accordance with best practices, as well as, being a business partner to identify and lead the implementation of systems that meet business requirements. You will be responsible for partnering with clients to complete all phases of a project including defining the project, gathering requirements, designing or acquiring a solution and completing systems implementation. You will also be responsible for recommending and managing software testing programs, documenting test results, and reviewing the results with the involved functional and technical groups.

Minimum of 1 year of BA required. Recent college graduates are encouraged to apply.

Additional Duties Include:

Ensure delivered solutions are of high quality with little to no post production deployment issue through the management of quality assurance processes
Establishment of quality assurance / quality control policies and practices that are in accordance with best practices.
Assist in development of test case scenarios and test plans for business and technology
Lead business and technology testing efforts which include but not limited to:
Developer unit testing
End to End system integration testing
System and Business process regression testing
Coordinate testing across multiple functional areas on varying applications and platforms. Log, track, and manage defects to closure.
Provide level two support by working with the business, external vendors, and IT Help Desk to resolve production issues for applications within your area of ownership
Gather and analyze data to discover problems and propose corrective action.
Evaluate vendor software patches and assess impacts and benefits.
Support data transmission and communication requirements to internal and external vendors.
Be available for nights and weekend support calls to resolve critical production issues
Provide end user production support.
Coordinate and provide support for systems implemented.
Manages business unit’s prioritization of projects and tasks, communicates delivery schedules, milestones, leading\driving project, blocking issues and obtains shared resources as needed to deliver on business requirements.
Gathers business requirements and transfers them into meaningful technical requirements
Coordinate and support the integration of Coborn’s existing applications and third party applications
Implementation of best practices including configuration, documentation, testing, training, installation, and conversion of existing data.
Create functional specifications for proposed solutions. This may include system configuration specifications and reporting specifications.
Analysis-develops detailed functional specifications for modifications, defect corrections, enhancements and user documentation; performs process and data modeling.
Document data requirements and selection rules for interfaces and conversions.
Performs analysis on process flows and will help identify opportunities to implement or enable technology to streamline operations.
Assist with development and delivery of end user training.
Requirements:
We believe that building a team of people with different backgrounds, beliefs, experiences and perspectives inspires fresh thinking and opens us up to new possibilities. We are an EEO/AA Employer - All qualified individuals, including minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
What's In It For Me:
Our remarkable employees strive to inspire happiness, healthy living and simplicity one guest at a time. With a vibrant and fun work environment, ongoing opportunities for career growth, and generous benefit packages, Coborn's offers a bright future for all employee owners.

We’re proud to offer a variety of benefits to both our full-time and part-time employees including:


A 10% Employee Discount (for the employee and their immediate household) and if you work at a location with a coffee shop, you’ll receive a discount there too!
Get Paid Daily with DailyPay – for employees who would like access to their pay before payday, we offer this great benefit!
Paid Time Off (PTO/Vacation)
Paid Floating Holidays & 1 - ½ time for hours worked on a company-recognized Holiday!
Sunday Premium Pay – An extra $1 per hour for hours worked on Sundays
Paid Military Leave
Employee Health & Wellness Programs, Challenges and Resources – to assist our team members live a life of wellbeing!
Employee Assistance Program (EAP) – unlimited phone access to legal, financial, and work-life services and up to five free in-person counseling sessions, per situation/issue, per year.
Tools, resources and opportunities for Career Growth & Development
401(k) plan options – we also match up to 20% of the first 5% contributed
Participation in our Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP) – yes, we’re employee-owned. Our team members benefit from the success of the company through this company-sponsored benefit!
Additional Voluntary Benefits – such as Vision, Accident and Critical Illness Insurances

If you’re hired or promoted into a full-time position with our company, you will also be eligible for: Medical & Dental Insurance, Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Tuition Reimbursement, Adoption Reimbursement, Paid Family Caregiver Leave, as well as company-sponsored Term Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance, and Short-Term & Long-Term Disability Insurance!

As a member of our team, you can also expect:

Flexible scheduling - We understand that many of our employees are trying to juggle school, practice, family time, errands and personal hobbies, all with only about 16 hours of awake time in a day.
Recognition - We celebrate a culture of recognition, encouraging employees to recognize and thank one another for remarkable behavior. We even have an app for that!
Growth Opportunities - We're always looking for motivated, high-potential employees who want to be part of our next generation of leaders! There are opportunities to grow within our company to positions you may not yet even know exist. Coborn's, Inc. offers a variety of development programs for employees who want to grow their careers with us.

Our culture celebrates employee ideas and encourages creative innovations. We're growing, learning, and overflowing with energy. In a dynamic atmosphere that welcomes diversity, we are investing in our employees, along with the growth of our company. We invite you to join us in carrying out our vision to “Be Remarkable!” Apply today!

Make your mark at the world's largest HVAC company

Why You'll Love Working for Daikin:

We're a group who operates with a people-centered mindset, believing in the unlimited potential of each employee, with a goal of driving our company to its fullest potential.
Our goal is to “Perfect the Air We Share”. We do this through cutting edge innovation & sustainability efforts while meeting the HVAC needs of thousands of customers - expanding over 160 countries!
Our culture is unrivaled. Daikin operates under 8 Core Values which are embedded into every aspect of our business. It's through these values that we continuously strive to build a place where everyone can be authentic, feel valued and heard, and have a sense of purpose and belonging.

The Sr Software Business Analyst leads a skilled software team developing custom software applications for the number one HVAC company in the world. Successful candidate will work with a diverse group including Marketing, Engineering, IT and end users to develop custom built, easy to use and intuitive selection and simulation applications.

A Day in the Life:

Leads the team and provides leadership, coaching, and/or mentoring
Translates business requirements into functional requirements and technical specifications for development of new computer software applications or for enhancements to existing systems
Leads collection and analysis of possible project engagements, documenting project scope (objectives, deliverables, critical success factors, assumptions, global and regional considerations, and resource requirements), prioritization, cost/benefit, potential risks, and feasibility
Translates and implement Engineering product structure and configuration rules into the software using basic nested if-then logic
Lead the development and review (from content to final draft) of user guides, training classes, and other end user documentation for applications and processes

What's in It For you:

Medical/Dental/Vision coverage, PTO, 401K match, support for community involvement and much more!
The ability to make an impact and shape your career with a company that is passionate about growth
The support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives, and ideas to achieve our best

What you will Bring:

Bachelor's degree (Mechanical, Industrial, or related Engineering, Computer Science, Math or Business) from four-year college or university
4+ years of related experience
MS Excel, Outlook & Word skills

Preferred

HVAC background with knowledge of equipment and components and their function within a system and a building is desired
Macro VBA Programming skills

Requirements · Ability to work remote or onsite as needed. · Five (5) years of Business Analysis experience; at Least two of those years need to be in a Senior or Lead Business Analyst Role · Two (2) engagements lasting more than six (6) months each in a Business Analyst Role · Two (2) years of experience leading requirements gathering sessions · Two (2) years of experience directly interacting with Project Sponsors, Stakeholders, Subject Matter Experts and Development Team Members. · One (1) year of experience using remote team collaboration tools such as: Microsoft Teams, Skype, SharePoint, etc. Preferred Requirements · Lead of a project work stream or Business Analyst team on a project lasting more than six months · Experience working in a Project Management Office · Being assigned to multiple projects concurrently · Project experience with systems that leverage data from multiple sources across an organization · Experience gathering requirements and configuration needs of a COTS system implementation · Experience with all aspects of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) · Experience with different project methodologies (Waterfall, Agile) · Bachelor’s degree in Information Services · Business Analyst Certification (IIBA certification or equivalent)

Job Description:
Summary:
This person will provide environmental permitting, compliance, and sustainability support by maintaining, managing, and implementing environmental management information systems. This person will work with clients to identify, scope, and manage environmental review, permitting, and compliance projects and provide technical solutions and support. Work will involve creating SQL -based regulatory reports, troubleshooting technical issues with the software platform, developing integrations with other data sources, creating compliance dashboards and email notifications, identifying data gaps, providing regulatory assistance for the preparation of compliance plans, and reviewing regulations and technical documents. Work may also involve performing environmental data analytics and generating dashboards to support clients in monitoring performance, enhancing environmental compliance, and bolstering ESG initiatives.
Minimum Qualifications:
5 years of experience supporting environmental software implementations in a consulting or industrial environment
Proficiency with SQL
Experience with air emission calculations
Experience and/or familiarity with federal and state environmental regulatory programs
Strong technical and problem-solving skills, including attention to detail, accuracy, and completeness, as well as a commitment to producing high-quality deliverables
Strong oral and written communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with project team members, clients, and regulatory staff
Demonstrated ability to fulfill commitments on schedule and to do what it takes to meet clients' service expectations and requirements
Effectiveness in building working relationships and working on multidisciplinary project teams
A flexible working style and willingness to occasionally modify personal schedule as required to meet project deadlines and/or client needs
Self-initiative and motivation, with an emphasis on client service and cultivating a career in environmental consulting
Acceptable driving record
Ability to travel to client locations and other Barr offices
Legal authorization to work in the United States or Canada without the need for sponsorship
Preferred Qualifications:
Proficiency with Intelex ACTS and/or V6 software
Experience with off-the-shelf EHS software packages, such as EarthSoft EQuIS, Enablon, Cority, Sphera, and/or SAP EHS
Proficiency with database and programming platforms such as Power BI, XML, HTML, Java, Python, or similar
Familiarity with requirements gathering, documentation, and organizational change management
Experience with Agile and Waterfall project management methodologies
Knowledge of and familiarity with federal and state regulatory agency staff, resource managers, and other government officials
Ability to process complex or rapidly developing information to extract key issues and implications and develop appropriate strategies
Experience training and mentoring staff
Aptitude for developing client relationships, leads, and opportunities and turning them into business
Colorado/Nevada Applicants Only:
Compensation:
The anticipated base salary range for this position is $96,000–$119,000. Compensation will vary based upon experience, education, skill level, and other compensable factors. Employees in this position may also be eligible for a discretionary cash bonus. Our compensation comes in more ways than traditional base salary, and we believe that when all those elements are combined, our compensation is a competitive part of the total value proposition of working at Barr.

Benefits:
People report that they stay at Barr because of the camaraderie and career opportunities. Another draw is our competitive package of employee benefits, which includes professional development funding, 401(k) retirement savings plan, employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) participation, medical and dental insurance, life insurance, disability and accidental death insurance, flexible spending accounts for healthcare and dependent care expenses, paid holidays, paid time off, and compensatory time for exempt/salaried staff (time off or pay for extra time worked).
This position can be served from any of Barr's U.S. locations. Barr may consider a remote working arrangement based on candidate qualifications. Fulfillment of the position responsibilities will require periodic travel.

Barr Engineering is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

All required qualifications must be documented in application materials.

Required Qualifications:

BA/BS and 6+ years of relevant analytical or quantitative work experience, or an advanced degree with a minimum of 4 years of experience in areas directly related to the position. Experience must include a minimum of three years of experience querying, extracting, formatting, and analyzing healthcare data such as inpatient/outpatient clinical records, labs, medications, provider data, and/or claims.
Experience working with messy real-world data.
Experience working independently in a rapidly changing scientific environment.
Proficiency with query development and report writing.
Demonstrated experience with T-SQL, PL/SQL, SAS and/or R programming languages.
Knowledge of healthcare data management concepts and regulatory/compliance policies (HIPAA, IRB, etc.).
Superior human relation skills, such as, the ability to use positive language communications to serve and influence our customers and stakeholders
Ability to participate in occasional domestic travel to attend conferences or training workshops.
Ability to support multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize assignments and work under limited supervision.
Comfortable providing rapid and timely response to urgent requests.
Comfortable following directions/instructions from supervisors and senior staff.

Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of clinical data and healthcare code sets and ontologies (ICD9/ICD10, CPT, NDC/RXNorm, LOINC, etc.).
Strong customer-facing experience, preferably with physicians, investigators, faculty/academic and research support staff.
Experience with data visualization tools (Qlikview, Tableau).
Research experience is a plus.
Exposure to statistical modelling and/or advanced analytics using R or Python.
This Clinical Data Analyst / Informatics Consultant will work in Clinical and Translational Science Institute (CTSI) supporting Biomedical Informatics.

Principle Duties

10% Communication: Work with investigators, research personnel and other stakeholders to promote informatics services.

Promote available CTSI Informatics services to investigators and research staff.
Coordinate user testing/usability evaluation of offered services and capture needs for potential future enhancements.
Ensure service delivery progress, delays and/or issues are regularly communicated with team management.

30% Informatics Consultation: Document project requirements, implementation plan, change management, execution and delivery.

Create consultation reports that capture project requirements, the implementation plan, as well as, the execution and delivery of the project or product.
Ensure that all informatics activities meet various compliance standards, IRB, data security, and contractual obligations of the University of Minnesota.
Follow standard operating procedures and adhere to team policies and best practices.
Strive for a high quality client experience and excellent user satisfaction.
Discuss and provide feedback related to opportunities for enhancement with team management.
Follow-up with investigators and staff to ensure delivered services meet users’ expectations.
Train users on data access procedures, analysis tools, and informatics infrastructure.

60% Technical: Query, extract, integrate, format, deliver and analyze data as per project needs.

Run feasibility analysis to ensure project requirements can be processed through available informatics services. Assess availability of raw data and provide information about data quality to investigators and research personnel.
Write code to query raw data and perform data transformation using tools such as SMMS, SQL Developer, SAS and/or R.
Explore, investigate and propose alternative ways of identifying patient cohorts when data elements are not clear or are unavailable.
Work closely with other team members to review execution plans and validate results.
Continually seek to improve knowledge of new clinical data sources.

The University of Minnesota, Twin Cities (UMTC)

The University of Minnesota, Twin Cities (UMTC), is among the largest public research universities in the country, offering undergraduate, graduate, and professional students a multitude of opportunities for study and research. Located at the heart of one of the nation's most vibrant, diverse metropolitan communities, students on the campuses in Minneapolis and St. Paul benefit from extensive partnerships with world-renowned health centers, international corporations, government agencies, and arts, nonprofit, and public service organizations.

At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed.
