Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

Job Description
Partners with their assigned Line of Business, other Risk/Compliance/Audit (RCA) professionals, and RCA Managers to, depending on their function, create, implement, maintain, review or oversee an effective risk management framework. Participates in projects and/or activities that ensure compliance with applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. Identifies gaps and inform solutions that minimize losses resulting from inadequate internal processes, systems or human errors. Identifies, responds and/or escalates risks as appropriate. Serves as a functional liaison between the Line of Business and the Lines of Defense.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience
Typically more than five years of applicable experience

Preferred Skills/Experience

Advanced knowledge of applicable laws, regulations, financial services, and regulatory trends that impact their assigned line of business
Advanced understanding of the business line’s operations, products/services, systems, and associated risks/controls
Thorough knowledge of Risk/Compliance/Audit competencies
Strong analytical, process facilitation and project management skills
Effective presentation, interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
Proficient computer navigation skills using a variety of software packages, including Microsoft Office applications and word processing, spreadsheets, databases, and presentations
Applicable professional certifications

Essential Duties:

Data Aggregation / Preparation

Ability to gather and aggregate data from a variety of disparate U.S. Bank-related data resources.
Ability to develop appropriate processes designed to transform native data into an easily consumable product.
Ability to perform complex data analysis in order to identify trends, outliers, & process improvement opportunities.
Ability to develop comprehensive documentation designed to appropriately document a process, ensure business continuity, and allow for continued governance.

Application / Reporting

Ability to develop insightful and compelling applications and/or dashboards that are designed to (1) create awareness of potential issues and (2) highlight process improvement opportunities.
Ability to collaborate with a high volume of internal customers, such as business lines, internal auditors, and regulatory examiners, identify their needs, and develop workable ad-hoc data-related solutions.
Partner with a number of business lines to improve data collection and integration, as well as continue driving overall Bank-wide data handling methods and systems into a more uniform, less segmented system and/or series of systems;

If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.


Benefits:

Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):

Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)

Basic term and optional term life insurance

Short-term and long-term disability

Pregnancy disability and parental leave

401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan

Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)

Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities

Adoption assistance

Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law

EEO is the Law

U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

E-Verify

U.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services.

The salary range reflects figures based on the primary location, which is listed first. The actual range for the role may differ based on the location of the role. In addition to salary, US Bank offers a comprehensive benefits package, including incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase 401k contribution and pension (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Pay Range: $87,465.00 - $102,900.00 - $113,190.00

Job Title: Corporate Services Business Analyst - Hybrid in Minnetonka, MN
Job Description:
UnitedHealth Group is a health care and well-being company that’s dedicated to improving the health outcomes of millions around the world. We are comprised of two distinct and complementary businesses, UnitedHealthcare and Optum, working to build a better health system for all. Here, your contributions matter as they will help transform health care for years to come. Make an impact with a diverse team that shares your passion for helping others. Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together.

At UnitedHealth Group, we're changing the future of health care and we have the expertise, advanced technology, and global resources to make it happen. As a Senior Business Analyst, you'll work with the brightest minds in the business and find yourself digging deep to find the solutions to help people live healthier lives. You'll be responsible for analyzing, reviewing, and forecasting data for operational and business planning to impact the health care system. What could be more satisfying than that?

UHG Corporate Services is a dynamic member of UnitedHealth Group, one of the largest health care companies in the world. We’re doing everything in our power to make health care work better for everyone. That includes the entire spectrum of health care participants: individual consumers and employers, commercial payers and intermediaries, physicians, hospitals, pharmaceutical and medical device manufacturers, and more. Corporate Services includes departments that provide vital support and partnership to UHG business customers and includes, Enterprise Procurement, Enterprise Real Estate Services, and Reporting, Data, and Analytics. Corporate Service departments provide innovative strategic planning and execution, analysis and reporting to ensure the enterprise operates at its highest potential.

As a UHG Corporate Services Senior Business Analyst in Reporting, Data, and Analytics team, you will work closely with UHG Corporate Services management to participate in analysis that may include any of the following: internal consulting, business case development, strategic alliance and change management, cost savings initiatives, marketing of the strategic sourcing organization and supplier diversity, financial modeling analysis of projects and proposals, and analyzing spend to develop innovative strategies that drive business value and enterprise consistency.

Candidates should be able to gather business information and synthesize it logically and analytically to communicate an effective message to leadership.

This role will support the Reporting, Data, and Analytics team on all goals, objectives, research, recommendations, partnerships, projects, and programs as assigned. You will be empowered to support short and long term operational/strategic business activities and develop, enhance, and maintain operational information and models that will have an impact on business decisions. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make contributions and create valuable solutions to improve the health care system.

Primary Responsibilities:

Provide analysis to support decision making including presenting economic outcomes and identifying key value drivers, benefits, perspectives, and risks
Effectively work with data produced through several digital tools, environments, and services. Requires comfort in ambiguity
Analyze, review, forecast, and trend complex data, including financial data
Provide insights and thought leadership to internal customers advising on options and contributing to decision making
Develop business cases to support strategic business activities and decisions
Present analysis and interpretation for operational and business review and planning
Develop concise, data-driven communications to influence internal customers, business partners and leadership; simplify complex information to ensure understanding
Develop ad-hoc client and operational reports and analysis to support Corporate Services’ initiatives
Present analysis and findings for operational/business review and planning purposes
Support short and long term operational/strategic business activities through online research and analysis
Develop recommended business solutions through research and analysis of data and business process to implement when appropriate

This is a complex, fast-paced, matrixed environment with a lot of moving parts. The challenge is in developing, enhancing and maintaining operational information and models. You'll be expected to interpret and analyze large amounts of data from multiple sources and use it to tell a meaningful story to a variety of stakeholders and personalities.

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelors’ degree in Business, Finance, Health Administration, related field, or 3+ years of experience in business / financial analysis
3+ years of experience in business / financial analysis
Experience with requirements scoping, financial analysis and compiling / communicating the findings and recommendations
Experience with process improvement, workflow, benchmarking and / or evaluation of business processes
Experience gathering and documenting requirements from the client / business
Advanced Excel proficiency including financial and scenario based modeling/analysis
Demonstrated ability to develop model, communicate analysis, including trends and opportunities, effectively and concisely to internal customers, both in writing and verbally
Demonstrated ability to problem solve performing research conflicting / inaccurate or ambiguous data
Hybrid working model with minimum three days in the Minnesota Corporate office. Flexible on day selections
Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship, now or in the future, for employment-based work authorization (F-1 students with practical training and candidates requiring H-1Bs, TNs, etc. will not be considered)

Preferred Qualifications:

MBA degree
Software experience with SQL and Tableau
Multiple years of experience gathering requirements from the client/business and documenting
Experience with process improvement, workflow, benchmarking and / or evaluation of business processes
Experience working with statistical models and performing statistical analysis
Ability and experience developing business cases (operational and financial) to support transformative initiatives
Working knowledge of relational databases and database structures
Proven solid history of quickly gaining credibility, partnering with business leaders, and exhibiting executive presence
Proven ability to articulate business strategies and formulate concise solutions to complex problems
Proven solid consultative, interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
Proven champion continuous change, consult with versatility, exhibit personal leadership, and model a customer orientation

At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

Data tells a story. Data drives smart decisions. Data is a difference-maker for companies that want to build a thriving workforce and successful business. If this approach resonates with you, this role is meant for you.

As a Sr. People Analytics Analyst at Marvin, you will be responsible for producing business-critical people insights in a clear, digestible way to HR partners and leaders across the organization.

You will be based at company headquarters, in Warroad, Minnesota, so you can be close to our largest workforce and build strong partnerships with key stakeholders.

In addition to a best-in-class benefits package, we also offer a $5000 sign-on bonus and a relocation bonus (when applicable).

Highlights of your role

Determine and deliver an optimum and clear way to present data to our HR partners and Marvin leadership, including developing and maintaining HR scorecards/dashboards.
Implement technically advanced, automated, and sustainable solutions to analytic requests.
Support employee engagement survey administration and results interpretation
Lead efforts to ensure HR data integrity and governance, ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.
Develop and maintain regular cadence of people analytics and insights to inform HR data-driven decisions.

You're a good fit if you have

Analytical and critical thinking in interpreting data.
Comfort in leveraging a wide variety of complex data sources in analysis efforts.
Ability to use data, analytics, and business knowledge to solve complex business problems.
Effective verbal/written communication skills, and ability to translate complex information into common language.
Strong project management and organization skills.
Proven track record of superior service delivery.
Expert Excel skills required.

Education/Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Human Resources, or related field
5+ years of experience in workforce analytics, business intelligence and/or data analysis, preferably in People/HR team
Interest or experience in the Human Resources field is strongly desired
Strong track record of success using one or more BI platforms / visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau)
Knowledge or interest with relational databases and/or data warehouses is a plus

Your opportunity for better living
At Marvin, we’re driven to imagine and create better ways of living. And that goes beyond our customers, to our communities and the colleagues beside us every day. We offer competitive compensation, an extensive benefits package that includes health insurance on day one of employment, paid time off and paid holidays, and a 401K retirement savings match.

We also support your overall wellness in other meaningful ways, including your own company-funded well-being account that can be used for anything from travel to a day at the spa, gym memberships or fun experiences with family and friends. You will be rewarded through our profit-sharing program, which recognizes the important role all employees play in making Marvin a success year, after year.

As a premier company with locations across North America, Marvin’s portfolio also includes three additional premium brands: Infinity Replacement Windows, TruStile Doors, and Marvin Coastline. Together, we share one purpose and live our values. Our culture is built on generations of doing the right thing and putting our people first. Join us, and experience better living at Marvin.




Marvin is an Equal Opportunity Employer

This job posting is not designed to include or contain a comprehensive listing of the activities, duties, or responsibilities of the employee. Marvin will make a reasonable accommodation for individuals with a mental or physical disability to apply for jobs and to perform the essential functions of the position unless it would cause an undue hardship. Any offer of employment is contingent on satisfactory completion of a drug screen to company standards.

Job Title: IT Data Analytics Product Owner and Business Analyst
Job Description:
Overview:
Cretex Summary
Cretex is a diversified family of manufacturing companies serving the medical contract manufacturing market. For over a century, Cretex Companies has been expanding to new industries, investing in innovative technologies, making strategic business acquisitions, and cultivating our team. Our strong financial position and long-term perspective enables us to better serve our customers in the manufacturing and engineering services now and for years to come. We're excited to have you join our team!
Responsibilities:

Position summary

As the Data/Analytics Product Owner / Business Analyst, you will shape the strategic vision of our data products and ensure that this vision is implemented effectively. This hybrid role will require you to understand business needs, analyze and interpret data, and use these insights to drive decision-making. You'll collaborate with stakeholders, data analysts, and data engineers to develop a roadmap and deliver successful outcomes.




Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand business processes, identify opportunities for leveraging company data, and drive business solutions.
Perform business analysis to identify data requirements and ensure that they align with the business strategy and objectives.
Define and prioritize the product backlog items, balancing the requirements of stakeholders with the resources of the development team.
Drive the planning, execution, and delivery of data-focused projects, ensuring that the team is working on the highest-priority items.
Develop user stories and acceptance criteria to clearly communicate the business needs to the data team.
Monitor the effectiveness of data products post-implementation and use feedback to inform future improvements.
Work closely with the Scrum Master and data team to ensure user stories are clear and the team is ready to execute them.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g. Computer Science, Business, Data Analytics).
Prior experience in a Product Owner, Business Analyst, or similar role, with a focus on data or analytics.
Experience with Agile methodologies and tools.
Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to think outside the box.
Excellent leadership, communication, and teamwork skills.
Strong data literacy — ability to understand and use data to make decisions.
Desirable Qualifications
Prior experience in manufacturing is a plus.
Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) certification.
Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools like Tableau or PowerBI.
Applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, disability, age, veteran status, marital status, family status, status with regard to public assistance, or any other protected status as required by law.
Cretex uses E-Verify to confirm the employment and eligibility of all newly hired employees. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, please visit www.dhs.gov/E-Verify

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!
We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets, an ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work® Institute and recognized as a ‘Cool Vendor’ and a ‘Vendor to Watch’ by Gartner.
Job Overview
In this role as a Business Analyst with an added focus on data engineering, you will assist in developing, deploying, and supporting various Digital Foundation (DF) initiatives and Smart Manufacturing applications. Your role will involve traditional business analysis tasks and working closely with data engineering technologies and practices. You should have a solid customer-facing background, with experience in the manufacturing process (food and beverage industry preferred but optional) and be comfortable working with team members across different time zones.
Your primary responsibility will be to work closely with business users to define problem statements/requirements, create and review mapping documents for data engineers, perform data analysis, manage data integration and quality checks, and ensure that data structures are designed effectively for analytical needs.
Responsibilities:
Participate in scrum calls to align with stakeholders on requirements, data strategies, and action plans.
Gather and translate business requirements into data models, data flow diagrams, and specifications for various Smart Manufacturing initiatives.
Contribute to the design, development, configuration, and validation of new product features, focusing on data integration and architecture.
Support ongoing data function initiatives, including data warehousing, data lakes, and big data platforms.
Assist plants in identifying, mapping, and onboarding Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and ensuring data pipelines are built and maintained to support these KPIs.
Proactively identify, analyze, and troubleshoot data-related issues: accuracy, consistency, delays, etc., including data pipeline debugging and optimization.
Collaborate with the Digital Foundation team and data engineers in identifying dependencies and data requirements for new features and ongoing initiatives.
Advocate for data quality, integrity, and reliability throughout the organization.
Skills and qualifications:
Business analysis and exposure to the manufacturing/CPG domains are necessary.
Proficiency in SQL and experience in database management or data warehousing technologies is required.
Familiarity with data engineering tools and practices, such as ETL processes, data modeling, and data pipeline management.
Exposure to Azure DevOps, cloud data services (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks), and agile ways of working is required.
Prior experience in OSI PI configuration, data integration, and troubleshooting is desirable. Knowledge of data visualization tools like Microsoft Power BI and familiarity with Microsoft PowerApps and SharePoint is desirable.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to translate complex data concepts for non-technical stakeholders.
Pay:
The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Fractal, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is: $96,000 - $135,000. In addition, you may be eligible for a discretionary bonus for the current performance period.
Benefits:
As a full-time employee of the company or as an hourly employee working more than 30 hours per week, you will be eligible to participate in the health, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability plans in accordance with the plan documents, which may be amended from time to time. You will be eligible for benefits on the first day of employment with the Company. In addition, you are eligible to participate in the Company 401(k) Plan after 30 days of employment, in accordance with the applicable plan terms. The Company provides for 11 paid holidays and 12 weeks of Parental Leave. We also follow a “free time” PTO policy, allowing you the flexibility to take time needed for either sick time or vacation.
Fractal provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

Datasite is where deals are made. We provide the data rooms and SaaS technology used in M&A and other high-value transactions, to deliver projects in more than 170 countries. Carrying that success into the future is all about you. Your useful skills, your unusual experience, your unique ideas. Everyone here brings something unexpected. What’s yours? Invest your talents in us, and we’ll return the compliment.
Job Description:
The Sr Pricing Data Analyst is responsible for data analysis and modeling to derive insights that support data driven decision making related to pricing, packaging, and commercial strategy. This role focuses on transforming raw data into actionable insights and leveraging data-driven storytelling to influence commercial outcomes. An essential responsibility includes the development, monitoring, maintenance, and updating of various pricing metrics, reports, and dashboards to support ongoing monetization and price improvement efforts.
The role requires an analytics background with equal parts technical, business and communication skills. This role will report directly to the Senior Director, Pricing and Packaging Strategy and will work closely with other cross-functional teams across Datasite.

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time. This is a hybrid role; preferred location is MN or NY.
Responsibilities:
Aggregate, cleanse, and organize business data (e.g., product usage, pricing, billing, etc.) from disparate sources with varying degrees of data integrity.
Conduct thorough analyses to identify data driven insights from trends and anomalies to inform pricing, packaging, and commercial decisions.
Perform analyses and modeling to support various price improvement initiatives.
Develop, update, and maintain pricing metrics (e.g., Price-per-unit, ARPU, ASP) to measure pricing effectiveness.
Build, maintain and update dashboards, KPI tracking, and visualization/reporting on a regular basis.
Support weekly, monthly, quarterly reporting of pricing metrics, analysis, and guidance to stakeholders across the organization.
Support various analyses for pricing strategy related projects, including new product and feature rollouts.
Analyze customer spending trends and usage to assist in new product pricing and deal structuring for new contracts.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Finance, Data Science, Operations, SF practice, Engineering.
Participate in presentation of pricing analytics and reporting to various internal stakeholders.
Education, Experience Requirements & Essential Skills:
Bachelor’s degree in an analytical field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related).
4+ years of prior B2B (preferably SaaS) experience in an analytical business role, preferably in Pricing, Data Science, Finance or Sales Ops.
High proficiency in Excel skills (e.g., nested formulas, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP, INDEX/MATCH, SUMIFS), pivots and charting.
Proficiency in data manipulation, analysis, and visualization/BI tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, SF, CRM analytics, Power BI, Python, R).
Proficient in the remainder of Microsoft Suite (PowerPoint, Word, etc.)
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable recommendations.
Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to data accuracy and integrity.
Effective communication skills and ability to explain complex models in simple terms.
Ability to build relationships and collaborate regularly in a dynamic, cross-functional environment.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently, maintain accountability, and prioritize multiple projects.
Adaptability to operate within an unstructured environment with minimal or unclear business requirements as the company continues to evolve.
As a global organization, Datasite knows that diverse perspectives are essential to our success. We’re committed to maintaining a diverse workforce to serve our customers around the world. Datasite is an equal opportunity employer (EEO) and furthers the principles of EEO through Affirmative Action.

The Senior Business Analyst – SAP FINANCE will work closely with business partners and internal teams by providing functional expertise and insight to implement and execute complex process, data, and technology solutions for the SAP Finance solution. Candidates for this position are expected to be professionals with substantial knowledge in the implementation space and have experience on low, medium and high rigor IT projects This job requires an experienced analyst who can partner effectively with all levels of the organization, lead others, drive results, and make challenging decisions across extremely complex, varied tasks where problems are vaguely defined and strategic in nature.

This position participates and/or leads the implementation of the Finance Solution which supports and enables Finance / RTR Cash Management, Customs & Tax, Cost and Financial accounting processes for business units. This position will also collaborate and help support finance related activities within the other process areas.

This position is expected to follow the Project Delivery Process and Requirements Analysis framework.

Candidates must demonstrate the following competencies: Change Management, Ability to navigate through ambiguity, Collaborates beyond team boundaries, Courage, Resilience, Ability to translate the “As Is” to the “To Be” while understanding broader impact, Empathy and Effective Communication skills with BU facing partners.

Job Details

Description

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Effectively partner with financial business areas and provide subject matter expertise level support to enhance functional business areas through processes and systems improvements.
Work with stakeholders to identify and document business requirements for ERP (Epicor) enhancement projects.
Proactively identify areas of improvement, collaborate with key stakeholders to identify requirements and drive process and systems enhancements.
Work with stakeholders to document business requirements and business process flows in designing and preparing new systems or solutions. Define enhancements to existing systems in order to meet internal and external user requirements.
Conduct research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business unit, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible.
Analyze the impact of proposed solutions across the business. Develop use cases to explain and/or demonstrate business requirements and specifications to the IT team and contribute a business or process perspective during design reviews.

Gather lessons learned and obtain final project approval from sponsor and stakeholders.
Provide training and support to end-users to ensure successful adoption of ERP solutions.
Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices related to ERP implementation and management.
Perform other related duties as assigned.

Bachelor's degree in information technology discipline or related field.

7+ years experience as an ERP Business Analyst role, finance experience preferred.
In-depth knowledge of ERP systems, such as SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics. Epicor experience preferred.
Detailed understanding of business operations and accounting principles within an ERP manufacturing environment.
Successful project participation in major ERP upgrades or implementations.
Effective written, communication skills and demonstrated success in various project methodologies.
Detail-oriented, critical thinker with excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Experience working with business partners and supporting tasks across multiple projects.

Standard office environment

Profile Summary:
The Sr. IT Claims Business Analyst role supports our Claims Business by working with the development teams with responsibility for eliciting, understanding and documenting business needs to determine and recommend the most optimal solution to conduct software development. Assists in formulating creative, technical contributions to defining user business and functional requirements for enhancements and projects and implementing IT business solutions. Acts as an adept analytical resource focusing on critical business priorities. Assists in establishing plans for defining, delivering, enabling and supporting information technology components into the organization architecture.
Profile Description:
Support our Claims ecosystem product development (Salesforce, Workato, Digital Properties etc.) based on business needs
Direct the requirements development for applying technology to satisfy business needs
Proven Salesforce.com integration and administrative skills
Serve as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development team through which requirements flow.
Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.
Work directly with and serve as a liaison between business units, technology teams and support teams.
Assist/Partner with our Claims QA team in defining testing strategy and risks.
Provide consulting regarding the practices and methods for defining detailed business requirements including planning, documentation, analysis and alignment to corporate standards.
Partner with our Business BA team to elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis
Monitor and manage data integrity while promoting best practices for system usage.
Understands all aspects of Salesforce configuration and technical/functional capabilities, including all changes and potential system implications related to the Salesforce release upgrades.
Manage and configure Salesforce Sales & Service Cloud.
Proficient in Lightning Platform and capabilities.
Partners with our Software Development Consultant in auditing data to uncover data integrity issues and/or opportunities for process improvement.
Document and refine business requirements to describe the business needs to a functional requirement level without presuming a technical solution. Under the guidance of a Software Development Consultant, ensure requirements are verifiable and testable once a solution is defined
Support the execution of the development pipeline and delivery of Voya’s software products including vendor solutions to QA, and ultimately to production
Work in execution of product development across all teams as part of the development lifecycle
Operate at a high technical level for identified phases of IT projects.
Identify applicable technology optimizations/modernizations to given business problems with the assistance and direction of the Software Development Consultant
Supports project manager/release manager by developing detailed project information such as scope information, estimates, evaluation criteria and results, etc.
Assist in the enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.
Helps shape our evolving claims product model with process improvement consultation
Coaches and mentors where applicable in support of the requirements/design proc
Knowledge & Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in a directly related field
Eight + years of professional IT experience in technical and business analysis with 2+ years of Salesforce experience
Certified Salesforce Administrator essential required or willing to work towards in the first 12 months post hire. Salesforce Platform Dev I and II certifications desirable.
Required Skills:
Salesforce.com
Middleware tools (i.e. Adeptia/Workato)
Enterprise Testing, Quality Standards, and software product knowledge (architecture, infrastructure security, DevOps, etc.)
SDLC knowledge
Agile Software development environment methodologies
Business requirement knowledge (i.e. elicitation of requirements, planning, documentation, analysis and alignment to standards)
Functional requirement knowledge (i.e. elicitation of requirements, planning, documentation, analysis and alignment to standards)
Requirements Analysis, Planning & prioritization execution
Requirements Elicitation and facilitation execution
Financial Management knowledge
Organizational Change Management (OCM)
Supplier/Vendor management
Analytical /data analysis skills
Change Management
Coach/Mentor

Job Title: Senior Manufacturing Business Analyst/ Process Owner
Job Description:
We’re looking for people who put their innovation to work to advance our success – and their own. Join an organization that ensures a more secure world through connecting and protecting our customers with inventive electrical solutions.
The Senior Manufacturing Business Process Analyst / Process Owner collaborates with key business & digital teams and leaders to translate business needs into technology solutions for their functions. This role requires a solid understanding of in-depth manufacturing processes and how to apply technology solutions to drive process improvements leading to productivity, velocity & analytics. The role will drive process standardization, lead projects and enhancements applying a combination of Agile & Lean methodologies.
WHAT YOU WILL EXPERIENCE IN THIS POSITION:
Partner with Manufacturing business teams, leadership and stakeholders to facilitate & translate business strategies and requirements into current/future state process maps, specifications and user stories.
Work closely with Digital teams in design & development and Business teams in definition, testing & implementation of technology solutions.
Responsible for owning process & data standardization across multiple locations and manufacturing processes to achieve desired future state.
Utilize your project management skills to ensure on-time & on-budget project execution
Drive a culture of using data & advanced analytics concepts to identify & act upon opportunities to eliminate waste and drive velocity & productivity in our manufacturing processes.
YOU HAVE:
Business exposure across core Integrated Supply Chain (ISC) functions with deep experience in Manufacturing processes in a multi-site, complex manufacturing environment.
Deep subject matter expertise and architectural knowledge in technical solutions supporting manufacturing processes (ERP, MES, IoT / Factory 4.0, Analytics tools)
Experience leading large cross-functional teams through project scoping, business case development, planning & execution.
Bachelor’s degree in Business or Technology; ideally Supply Chain / Operations Management or related field and ideally 7+ years functional business experience preferred.
Ability to communicate with digital and business team members across multiple levels & functions of the organization
Results oriented; displays persistence when facing complex challenges; applies problem-solving skills and tools to overcome obstacles & drives accountability for self and team members
WE HAVE:
A dynamic global reach with diverse operations around the world that will stretch your abilities, provide plentiful career opportunities, and allow you to make an impact every day
At nVent, we connect and protect a more sustainable and electrified world with inventive electrical solutions. We’re a nearly $3 billion high-performance electrical company with a dedicated team of 10,000+ people at more than 130 sites around the world. Our solutions deliver value to industrial, commercial, residential, energy and infrastructure customers, providing mission critical solutions that improve performance, lower costs and reduce downtime.
We design, manufacture, market, install and service high-performance products and solutions that connect and protect mission critical equipment, buildings and essential processes. Our robust portfolio of leading electrical product brands dates back more than 100 years and includes nVent CADDY, ERICO, HOFFMAN, RAYCHEM, SCHROFF and TRACER.
Commitment to strengthen communities where our employees live and work
We encourage and support the philanthropic activities of our employees worldwide
Through our nVent in Action matching program, we provide funds to nonprofit and educational organizations where our employees volunteer or donate money
Core values that shape our culture and drive us to deliver the best for our employees and our customers. We’re known for being:
Innovative & adaptable
Dedicated to absolute integrity
Focused on the customer first
Respectful and team oriented
Optimistic and energizing
Accountable for performance
Benefits to support the lives of our employees
At nVent, we connect and protect our customers with inventive electrical solutions. People are our most valuable asset. Inclusion and diversity means that we celebrate and encourage each other’s authenticity because we understand that uniqueness sparks growth.

Job Title: Principal Business Analyst - Research - Business Intelligence
Job Description:
Why Mayo Clinic

Mayo Clinic is top-ranked in more specialties than any other care provider according to U.S. News & World Report. As we work together to put the needs of the patient first, we are also dedicated to our employees, investing in competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit plans – to take care of you and your family, now and in the future. And with continuing education and advancement opportunities at every turn, you can build a long, successful career with Mayo Clinic. You’ll thrive in an environment that supports innovation, is committed to ending racism and supporting diversity, equity and inclusion, and provides the resources you need to succeed.


Responsibilities


If you are seeking an exciting opportunity to be a part of a dynamic and collaborative team, keep reading. We are in the process of adding a Principal Business Analyst to our Business Intelligence Team, supporting Mayo Clinic’s Research Shield which transforms medicine to address the unmet needs of patients.

Acts as lead in the planning and execution of overarching business analysis endeavors. Has broad understanding and vision for future with ability to influence and execute strategy. Demonstrated agility in working with rapidly developing project scope and plan. Synthesizes and drives solutions between operations, work units, suppliers and technical area. Provides direction, coaching, training, and mentorship for team members and colleagues, as appropriate, in alignment with the project, program, or organizational structure. Responsible for the development of the business analysis approach. Takes a data-driven approach to reach decisions that support and advance business objectives. Ensures the developed solutions satisfy the stated requirements and business objectives. Develops strategic partnerships with internal and external business entities to develop a solid knowledge base of the business, including the strategic plan, deliverables, processes, and financial impacts. Leads or participates in the research and consolidation of information to identify and recommend potential business and organizational relationships and partnerships. Applies a strong knowledge base of relevant systems/applications as it relates to workflow, process, and problem resolution and recommends improvements. Researches and analyzes operational procedures and methods and recommends changes for improvement in efficiency and effectiveness. Stays current on knowledge, practices and trends in the industry that directly affect the business. May require matrix supervision and evaluation of staff from other departments and divisions, including external contractual partnerships. May have direct and indirect reports, and be in a position to employ and guide the business analysis staff in a goal-orientated manner within projects. The hire for this position must live within commuting distance within the MCR, MCA or MCF campus




Key Opportunities:

Address business needs through requirements gathering and successful translation of business requirements to technical teams.
Use creativity and insights to effectively communicate complex data topics to executive business leaders, providing business intelligence solutions that enable informed decision-making.
Leverage strategic thinking to anticipate needs, identify challenges, and build proactive reporting solutions.
Build and foster productive relationships with colleagues from diverse backgrounds.
Deploy your business acumen and ability to influence to foster candid discussions and understanding with business leaders and technical team members.


Qualifications


Qualifications: Bachelor's and 9 years experience in business analysis, business administration, engineering, information science, health or science-related field OR Master degree and 7 years' experience in business analysis, business administration, engineering, information science, health or science-related field.

Additional Qualifications: N/A

License or Certification: CBAP Certified Business Analysis Professional, CCBA Certification of Competency in Business Analysis, or PMI-PBA Professional in Business Analysis preferred.


Exemption Status

Exempt

Compensation Detail

Education, experience and tenure may be considered along with internal equity when job offers are extended. $101,025.60- $151,528.00 annually.

Benefits Eligible

Yes

Schedule

Full Time

Hours/Pay Period

80

Schedule Details

M- F- 8-5 This position works remotely 50% or more of the time; business needs require employees to live within a reasonable driving distance of campus.

Weekend Schedule

Work does not normally occur on weekends, with rare exceptions based on project needs.

International Assignment

No

Site Description

Just as our reputation has spread beyond our Minnesota roots, so have our locations. Today, our employees are located at our three major campuses in Phoenix/Scottsdale, Arizona, Jacksonville, Florida, Rochester, Minnesota, and at Mayo Clinic Health System campuses throughout Midwestern communities, and at our international locations. Each Mayo Clinic location is a special place where our employees thrive in both their work and personal lives. Overview:

Key Responsibilities:
Able to perform cost, benefit and risk analysis associated with the proposed product/services and recommend alternatives for solutions throughout the product life cycle.
Collaborates with stakeholders and users to synthesize, articulate, and document business and system requirements.
Performs data analysis, defines, and documents business requirements, translates business requirements to technical/engineering specifications, acceptance criteria, user experience requirements and system validation while considering the complete technical and non-technical solution.
Technical specifications are utilized by Engineering/IT in the final technical design and eventual product build/acquisition or integration.

Researches, analyzes, and validates complete and accurate business and systems requirements.
Establishes scope boundaries for basic and routine products and technical requirements with accuracy and clarity.

Assesses and defines problems through root cause analysis and proactively brings solutions to the table.

Applies system and analytical thinking methodology and discipline.

SUMMARY
Ceres is looking for a Senior Business Analyst that can add value to our team. At Ceres, we wear many hats, and this position will too. The primary goal of this position is to centralize reporting and data analytics across the organization through Power BI. This position has a heavy emphasis on financial planning and analysis, but also supports all other functions of the organization, such as Operations, HR, Compliance, and Commercial. This is an exciting opportunity to drive and champion positive change in an organization.
Responsibilities
Analytics & Financial Reporting

Collaborate with business leaders to provide analytical thought leadership and support for business problems. Help identify and interpret business needs, define high-level business requirements, strategy, and scope. Develop, document, and communicate business-driven analytic solutions and capabilities. Translate modeling and analytic output into understandable and actionable business knowledge.
Analyze financial information and provide insights to enable the organization to achieve financial goals and objectives. Analyze financial data and create financial models and forecasting for decision support. Perform financial forecasting, reporting, and operational metrics tracking. Work closely with the accounting team to ensure accurate financial reporting. Coordinate the annual budgeting process.
Collaborate with other functions and key stakeholders to define requirements for metrics, tracking, and reporting.

Automation

Identify opportunities for automation and process improvement in business workflows.
Build intuitive and interactive Power BI dashboards and reports to communicate key metrics.

Data Management

Identify, gather, store, analyze, interpret, and visualize large amounts of data. Develop data reporting forms/structures.
Implement scalable data management practices.

Required
Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or related field.
5+ years relevant professional experience.
Strong financial acumen.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Experience reading and understanding data models.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to multi-task and prioritize diverse tasks.
Effective interpersonal and communication skills.
Experience in organizing, planning and executing projects from conceptualization through implementation and execution across multiple stakeholders.
Preferred
Prior experience and exposure in the grain and commodity industry.
Experience with SQL statements.
Experience with Microsoft GP and Power Query Editor.
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365) for Finance and Operations.

Christensen Farms is one of the largest, family-owned pork producers in the United States, marketing approximately 3 million hogs per year. Headquartered in Sleepy Eye, Minnesota, the company operates throughout the Midwest with facilities in Minnesota, Iowa, Nebraska, Illinois and South Dakota. Christensen Farms owns four feed mills, manages 145,000 sows on 44 farms, and oversees more than 350 nurseries and grow-finish sites. The company employees nearly 1,000 people and maintains 1,500 contract partnerships.





The company is vertically integrated with a strong presence across the pork value chain - from farm to fork. Christensen Farms is the largest shareholder of Triumph Foods LLC, a producer-owned primary pork processing plant in St. Joseph, Missouri. In turn, Triumph Food members own 50 percent of Daily's Premium Meats, a specialty pork processor bacon and other premium pork products. Triumph Foods also holds a 50 percent partnership in Seaboard Triumph Foods, LLC of Sioux City, Iowa, a primary pork processing plant.





Position Overview & Responsibilities

The Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for leading the requirements definition process of IT development and software implementation projects and participates through the whole software development (or implementation) life cycle process. Additionally, the BA serves as the primary level-2 support for assigned key business applications. In this capacity, the BA must gain/maintain a deep understanding of the underlying business processes being served by the related software functionality. The BA serves as a liaison between the business user and the technical resource (typically a software developer or implementer). The BA must work cooperatively and actively with both IT and business user resources, always seeking the highest quality and value achievement in each project.


Major Areas of Accountability

Gathers and documents requirements for new application functionality, whether custom software or off-the-shelf software configuration.
Provides 2nd level end user support for assigned business applications.
Documents current and desired business process flows and recommends solutions to fill gaps or to improve the flow and/or efficiency of processes.
Creates and maintains software based workflow processes as applicable.
Performs basic customizations within the assigned application suites to streamline or extend functionality.
Works closely with developers and business users to ensure that developed functionality meets documented requirements.
Develops and maintains user documentation including manuals and training materials.
Develops and maintains use case documentation for testing purposes.
Gathers and documents user suggestions for new features and content for assigned applications.
Leads QA/user acceptance testing of assigned applications, including custom applications.
Diagnoses application problems, determines root causes and either resolves the issue(s) or passes along to the relevant people that can resolve the issue.
Other duties assigned within the scope, responsibility, and requirements of the job.


Education, Training and Experience Requirements:

Minimum formal education required: Bachelor's degree in an IT related discipline or agricultural discipline or 6+ years of equivalent work experience.
Experience creating process maps, gathering business requirements, writing functional specifications, writing user stories, creating test plans and writing test scripts.
Clear, concise, and precise written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with people of various backgrounds including non-technical audiences.
Strong solution-oriented approach to team problem solving.
Ability to multi-task and to prioritize objectives, anticipate situations and take quick action.
Computer skills required: Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite including Visio


Additional Desirable Skills/Qualifications

Certifications in any of the following are a plus: Business Analysist (IIBA, PMI-PBA, etc.), ITIL.
Experience working in an agricultural business, particularly the swine industry.
Experience in Business Process Management.
Experience in Application Management
Experience in Database Management
Experience in Level 1 and/or Level 2 user support (Freshservice or similar ITSM tool).
Cloud technologies (Public, Private, Dedicated, Hybrid).
End user computing devices including Windows, Android, and iOS.

This job description is not intended to limit the responsibilities of an employee assigned to this position to those duties listed above. The employee is expected to follow any other instructions and perform any other duties requested by the immediate supervisor or company management. The level of involvement may vary based on company and individual capabilities.

Description:Hmong College Prep Academy’s mission is to provide the best integrated, challenging, and well-rounded educational experience to students in grades K-12.
If you want to make a difference as part of a dynamic educational community, we invite you to apply to join our team at Hmong College Prep Academy where graduates will be rich in experiences, culture, knowledge and pride, and will be ready for the challenges of college and beyond.
We are currently seeking a dedicated and energetic PowerSchool Administrator/Data Analyst to join our growing school.
This PowerSchool Administrator/Data Analyst will be instrumental to the overall operations, environment and culture of the school. They will build rapport and establish good relationships with students, parents, staff members and the community.
Hmong College Prep Academy stands out as a high quality school for both teachers and students, demonstrated in many ways:

Low 20:1 teacher/student ratio
Strong technology focus with 1:1 Android tablets for students
Standard student uniform policy
Robust professional development and mentoring program for teachers
Recognized by the Minnesota Department of Education as a Celebration School
Academic and extracurricular activities/teams such as Mock Trial, Band, Choir, Soccer and Volleyball
World Culture Day
College preparation programs and activities, such as a Big 10 Tour and college and career fair

We provide competitive pay and benefits, including:

An employee benefit package that includes coverage for medical, dental, vision, life and AD&D, long term disability, and a Flexible Spending Account
Matching funds for TRA and PERA retirement plans

For details on the benefits program go to: https://www.hcpak12.org/Page/136
To apply or check out other opportunities, go tohttps://www.hcpak12.org/careers
Equal Employment Opportunity: Hmong College Prep Academy District is an equal opportunity employer and supports an inclusive workplace environment.
Requirements:Position Responsibilities:

The PowerSchool Administrator is responsible for the technical administration of PowerSchool, PowerTeacher Pro, and PowerSchool customizations. Experienced with Autocomm, Autosend, Data Export Manager, PowerQueries, Object Reports, and Reportworks.
PowerSchool Administrator assists and trains school administrators, faculty, and staff with using these programs. The PowerSchool Administrator should be skilled in analyzing user requirements and designing functional speci?cations for extending PowerSchool (and edge systems as needed) to include new functionality, such as enhanced reporting and data.
PowerSchool Administrator should be able to assist with the systems administration and data integration of other information systems in use at Hmong College Prep Academy; including Schoology Learning Management System, Destiny Library, Viewpoint Data Warehouse, Primero Food Service, and SRC Registration gateways, as well as others.
This position will interact with students, faculty and staff, as well as the IT Department and vendors, so this person should have the ability to deal with a variety of users at different levels of technical skills and knowledge. This person should have good communication skills.

Qualifications/Skills:

BS in Computer Science or Information Systems or related area.
Minimum 3 years experience managing a PowerSchool student information system and PowerTeacher Pro gradebook.
Advanced SQL, scripting, HTML, and reporting skills. Oracle and web application development desirable. Competent in PowerSchool object reports and ReportWorks.
Ability to reconcile and analyze large datasets. Advanced Excel expertise. Attention to detail.
Academic software knowledge and experience (LMS, Content Management Systems, etc.) Experience with Learning Support and Student Assessment systems and/or other types of data analysis systems.
Strong communication, organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to multi-task, plan timelines, and coordinate with various departments; excellent time management, self-motivated.

Reports to: Chief Academic Officer
Duties:

Maintain the current PowerSchool and PowerTeacher Pro environments, including user accounts and security groups/roles, and recommend improvements in processes and work?ows according to PowerSchool best practices.
Plan, implement, coach, and train for new releases and program updates. PowerSchool is hosted and lags one version back. HCPA updates to a new version each summer.
Create and maintain advanced reporting capabilities within PowerSchool.
Create, maintain and implement Powerschool customizations and plugins.
Monitor ongoing operations and data integrity and do periodic student data audits. Support data analysis, student assessments and grading, and other reporting needs.
Work with other school staff to align PowerSchool and PowerTeacher Pro parameters (system con?gurations) to academic and other policies.
Maintain appropriate system documentation on procedures and con?gurations.
Provide technical assistance and user support for IT tickets and issues related to PowerSchool and Schoology.

Job Type: Full-time

Tech Lead, Data & Analytics
Work mode: Hybrid
Onsite Location(s): Maple Grove, MN, US, 55311

Additional Locations: US-MN-Arden Hills

Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High Performance

At Boston Scientific, we’ll give you the opportunity to harness all that’s within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we’ll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you’ll be supported in progressing – whatever your ambitions.




About the role:

As the Tech Lead of the Data and Analytics Team, you will be responsible for leading a group of talented data engineers and analysts in designing, implementing, and maintaining our data warehouse infrastructure and analytics solutions. You will be a hands-on leader with deep technical expertise in AWS and Snowflake, driving the team to deliver high-quality data products leading to key dashboards and actionable insights.





Your responsibilities will include:

Leadership of the data engineering and analytics team, ensuring best practices and efficient utilization of AWS and Snowflake technology.
Perform design and code reviews with data engineers.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and deploy scalable and robust data architectures, data pipelines, and analytics solutions.
Apply data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL and ELT) techniques to integrate large data sets from a variety of sources.
Create data collection frameworks for structured and unstructured data to transform complex raw data into highly performant usable information.
Develop and maintain infrastructure systems (e.g., data warehouses, data lakes) including data access APIs.
Lead dimensional data modeling activities.
Continuously monitor and optimize the data and analytics infrastructure for performance, cost-efficiency, and scalability.
Implement and enforce data governance policies, data security, and compliance standards across all data assets.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and make technical recommendations that meet their needs.
Develop user story estimates using story points.
Create and maintain comprehensive design documentation for data processes, architectures, and standards.
Lead troubleshooting efforts to identify and resolve data and analytics-related issues promptly.



What we’re looking for:
Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience with a focus on information technology, data management or related discipline strongly preferred.
8+ years of progressive data and analytics technical work experience in the healthcare industry with the medical device industry strongly preferred.
5+ years of experience with SQL
5+ years of Snowflake experience designing and deploying dimensional data warehouses.
3+ years of experience with AWS development.
3+ years of experience interpreting data models, schemas, and E-R diagrams.
A proven track record of successful technical team leadership in a cross-functional IT organization.
Strong analytical skills including proficiency in querying, analyzing, and summarizing data.
A proven ability to understand and communicate complex, interconnected systems and the data flowing between them.



Preferred Qualifications

Dimensional data modeling and architecture experience. ERWIN experience
SnowPro certification
DBT Cloud experience
Self-motivated and can work independently.
Time management skills.
Ability to manage multiple priorities.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.




Requisition ID: 571865




As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most – united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do – as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.




So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn’t just business, it’s personal. And if you’re a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you!

Job Title: Principal Business Analyst, Pricing and Contracts – Minneapolis, MN
Job Description:
Careers that Change Lives



Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions – we’re a market leader and growing every day. You can be proud to support medical technologies that are rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation. Our expanding portfolio delivers measurable clinical and economic value – and opens doors. You will be empowered to shape your own career. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Together, we can transform healthcare.

We believe that when people from different cultures, genders, and points of view come together, innovation is the result —and everyone wins. Medtronic walks the walk, creating an inclusive culture where you can thrive.



A Day in the Life
At Medtronic the Principal Contract Analyst has responsibility for working with the Cardiovascular Enterprise Accounts organization to develop and implement regional and local based contracts that support Medtronic Cardiovascular business strategies and objectives. The primary responsibility will be to work with the Cardiovascular Enterprise Accounts Sr Managing Directors and their direct reports to develop strategies and tactics that support revenue and market share growth in regional IDNs, and to conduct other financial and operational analysis to support contracting strategies as needed.

Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned.

Act as a liaison between the Enterprise Accounts organization and Operating Units to develop and implement regional contract strategies for Integrated Distribution Networks (IDN) that are consistent with the US Market objectives and support the Enterprise Accounts sales strategies.
Provide comprehensive business reviews, enable programs and contracts to drive revenue, monitoring pricing integrity and protecting margin will be key responsibilities.
Execute and monitor negotiated contracts from implementation to expiration to ensure accurate invoicing.
Support Customer Care, Credit Financial Services and other organizations to resolve pricing discrepancies and other related issues.
Support the contracting needs of the Enterprise Accounts assigned region. This includes executing on pricing strategies, strategy development in response to customer pricing requests and complying with the price governance process. Complete hospital requests in a timely manner in accordance with Medtronic pricing strategies, terms, and conditions.
Provide robust and accurate pricing analysis. Negotiate pricing under parameters as set forth by management in conjunction with Sales, Legal and Marketing. Provide rationale behind pricing approvals to help facilitate positive outcomes in pricing discussions.
Support quarterly business review efforts with regional offices and local sales teams as needed. Participate in cross-functional teams to develop strategy and tactics for key business initiatives across different functional areas.

This role is part of a hybrid team based in Medtronic's operation headquarters facility, and all candidates must be able to accommodate a weekly on-site requirement as part of the hybrid schedule.

Must Have: Minimum Requirements

To be considered for this role, please ensure the minimum requirements are evident on your resume.

Bachelors degree and 7+ years contracts, pricing, sales operations or finance/business analytics

OR

Masters degree and 5+ years contracts, pricing, sales operations or finance/business analytics

Nice to Have

Experience presenting to upper-level management and sales leaders
Confident in driving contracts and pricing strategy and able to influence key stakeholders to help drive negotiations toward a favorable outcome
Demonstrated proficiency with Excel Spreadsheets, Business Objects, and SAP.
Experience creating Excel documents, including spreadsheets, formulas, charts, graphs, and functions.
Additional experience in sales, marketing, purchasing, healthcare or related areas desirable.
Knowledge of contract law.
Ability to work in fast paced environment with high attention to detail.
Strong relationship building, communication and interpersonal skills.
Proven ability to operate in a matrixed marketing environment and work effectively with sales, sales
Proven ability to build and facilitate strong, productive working relationships with a wide variety of cross‐functional teams and customer contacts.
Ability to identify, analyze, and solve problems with minimal direction and make decisions with confidence.



About Medtronic



Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.

We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.

The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Job Title: Principal Data Science Analyst - Medical Imaging Technology
Job Description:
Why Mayo Clinic

Mayo Clinic is top-ranked in more specialties than any other care provider according to U.S. News & World Report. As we work together to put the needs of the patient first, we are also dedicated to our employees, investing in competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit plans – to take care of you and your family, now and in the future. And with continuing education and advancement opportunities at every turn, you can build a long, successful career with Mayo Clinic. You’ll thrive in an environment that supports innovation, is committed to ending racism and supporting diversity, equity and inclusion, and provides the resources you need to succeed.


Responsibilities

Data Scientists at Mayo Clinic perform detailed analysis of large bodies of heterogeneous data in order to discover new patterns and insights having an impact upon patient health and augmenting human capabilities. Candidate has deep expertise in AI, machine learning, deep learning, statistical data processing, regression techniques, neural networks, decision trees, clustering, pattern recognition, probability theory and data science methods and the mathematical theories underlying these tools used to analyze data. Has deep knowledge of healthcare data types, topics, and scientific challenges and approaches.
Work with knowledge architects, informaticians and clinicians at Mayo, and partner outside companies to develop and deploy applications to bring AI and analytic solutions to nontechnical users, often at the point of care.. Designs and develops scripts or software applications to support data management, data extraction, data analysis, and AI as required. This position may develop predictive and prescriptive models to address complex problems, discover insights, and identify opportunities using machine learning, statistical techniques, and data mining. Provides Consultative Services at an enterprise level to departments/divisions and/or may lead scientific projects. May have direct and indirect reports.

Other responsibilities:

Provides deep data insights for complex business problems that can be approached with analytics techniques to collect, explore, and extract insights from structured and unstructured data.
Develops predictive and prescriptive models to address complex problems, discover insights, and identify opportunities using machine learning, statistical techniques, and data mining.
Makes presentations on assigned projects or proposals.
Conducts advanced data analysis and designs highly complex algorithm systems.
Functions independently and initiates judgment in handling delegated responsibilities.
Experience leading technical/quantitative teams.
Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
Identifies/creates the appropriate algorithm to discover patterns.
Leads and directs the interpretation of data analysis and writing reports.



The Department of Radiology is growing the Framework for AI Software Technologies (FAST) program to establish the leading clinical AI program. The FAST program covers AI development from discovery to clinical implementation of AI algorithms to enhance patient care. The FAST program expansion includes Foundational model and LLM-based application to further offer innovative solutions to transform healthcare.


Qualifications


A Master's degree in a relevant field such as engineering, mathematics, computer science, health science, or other analytical/quantitative and a minimum of five years of professional or research experience in data science
The preferred candidate will possess a PhD in a relevant field such as engineering, mathematics, computer science, health science, or other analytical/quantitative field and a minimum of three years of professional or research experience in data science and statistical/machine learning packages.

The successful candidate will need to have both technical and business background/experience along with strong leadership skills. Good written and oral communication skills are required. Deep expertise in the use of scientific computing and data management packages. Ability to prioritize, organize, and delegate various tasks on projects. Demonstrated initiative in administration, education (seminars, training), software development, and technical reports. Demonstrated success in project management and communication skills.Demonstrated ability to develop predictive and prescriptive models on large-scale datasets to address various business problems through leveraging advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining techniques. Demonstrated ability to provide consultative services at an institutional or enterprise level to departments/divisions and committees from any Mayo entity requesting assistance is preferred. Demonstrated application of several problem-solving methodologies, planning techniques, continuous improvement methods, project management methods, and analytical tools and methodologies (e.g. machine learning, statistical packages, modeling, etc.) required. Incumbent must have ability to independently manage a varied workload of projects with multiple priorities and stay current on healthcare trends and enterprise changes. Excellent interpersonal skills to include presentation, negotiation, persuasion, and written communications skills are required. Exceptional time management is required. In addition, requires excellent analytical skills, consulting skills, ability to identify and recommend solutions, advanced computer application skills and a commitment to customer service. Experience with data modeling and date exploration tools.


Exemption Status

Exempt

Compensation Detail

$135,740.80 - $203,632.00 / year

Benefits Eligible

Yes

Schedule

Full Time

Hours/Pay Period

80

Schedule Details

Monday - Friday Days

Weekend Schedule

As needed

International Assignment

No

Just as our reputation has spread beyond our Minnesota roots, so have our locations. Today, our employees are located at our three major campuses in Phoenix/Scottsdale, Arizona, Jacksonville, Florida, Rochester, Minnesota, and at Mayo Clinic Health System campuses throughout Midwestern communities, and at our international locations. Each Mayo Clinic location is a special place where our employees thrive in both their work and personal lives.
