Job Title: Sr. Trade Spend Analyst, Revenue Growth Management (RGM)
Job Description:
Summary:
Come. Stay. Grow.
Our people make a difference! Advantage Solutions is a unique business solutions provider for nationally recognized manufactures and brands helping turn shoppers into buyers. We embrace a “Winning Together” mentality. Our solutions offer career opportunities across an array of disciplines, giving you control of your future. We value diversity, flexibility and individual growth. Come enjoy an environment of encouragement, thought leadership, creative collaboration, and teamwork.

Our Advantage Intelligence team is on the front lines, collaborating with sales, manufacturer clients and retailers to identify growth opportunities. We craft compelling and insightful selling stories that enable win/win scenarios. Unmatched analytical tools and resources help you gain insights into the what, why, where and how. Understand shopper needs and wants to drive brand growth for our clients. Bring your talent and skills to a company that values not only your contribution but you as a person.

Position Summary
The Sr. Trade Spend Analyst will help support the implementation of a TPx, TPO, or TPM solution. In addition, this person will analyze data to provide complex and comprehensive analysis for strategies and events to help develop recommendations for promotional and pricing guidelines. This person will track compliance to approved trade guidelines and collaborate with sales to improve ROI (Return on Investment) on promotions and pricing. The learnings will be shared back with Sales, Trade Marketing and Finance. The Sr. Trade Spend Analyst will support monthly channel/key account P&L reviews with the sales teams for improving net sales/gross margin and provide guidance to improve the annual target setting and planning cycle.

#ADVDigital
Responsibilities:
The Company is one of North America’s leading sales and marketing agencies specializing in outsourced sales, merchandising, category management and marketing services to manufacturers, suppliers and producers of food products and consumer packaged goods. The Company services a variety of trade channels including grocery, mass merchandise, specialty, convenience, drug, dollar, club, hardware, consumer electronics and home centers. We bridge the gap between manufacturers and retailers, providing consumers access to the best products available in the marketplace today.

Position Summary
The Sr. Trade Spend Analyst will help support the implementation of a TPx, TPO, or TPM solution. In addition, this person will analyze data to provide complex and comprehensive analysis for strategies and events to help develop recommendations for promotional and pricing guidelines. This person will track compliance to approved trade guidelines and collaborate with sales to improve ROI (Return on Investment) on promotions and pricing. The learnings will be shared back with Sales, Trade Marketing and Finance. The Sr. Trade Spend Analyst will support monthly channel/key account P&L reviews with the sales teams for improving net sales/gross margin and provide guidance to improve the annual target setting and planning cycle.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities
Data Collection & Analysis

Leverages COE system and IRI data to Collaborate on promo effectiveness reviews (including e.g., promotional responsiveness of products and brands, trade rates by account, event level ROI analysis) with Revenue Management/Trade Marketing teams
Lead analytics to support development of promotional guidelines based on trade promotion effectiveness for the brand portfolio / channels and key accounts
Analyze the ROI of additional trade spend levers to optimize the trade spend investment
Manage proprietary BI tool(s), to analyze data-intensive sales causal elements and identify key drivers and opportunities with respect to promotions, distribution, pricing, assortment and new items
Client/Customer Engagement

Supports the RGM / Trade Management team in the implementation and successful rollout of a TPx, TPO, or TPM solution (e.g. developing training materials, documenting processes, executing training sessions, inputting data or other activities)
Engages with customers and clients to understand strategies and objectives and conduct monthly review with Sales teams / VP of Sales for evaluating promo efficiency performance vs planned performance by channel/key accounts
Leverages knowledge on the industry to create mutually beneficial solutions for all parties involved. Build and maintain a positive, productive relationship with Trade Marketing, Field Sales, and Brand Team stakeholders
Collaborate with the Revenue Management Team for improving promotional planning and setting guardrails for Sales team execution
Presentation Development/Delivery

Creates insight driven presentations with actionable tactics and strategies to deliver business solutions for improving net sales return
Develops creative presentations with an eye toward story-telling, focused on flow, visualizations and headlines
Develop “Pay for Performance” Trade Investment strategic framework for customer negotiation


Supervisory Responsibilities
Direct Reports

This position does not have supervisory responsibilities for direct reports
Indirect Reports

This position does not have guidance or mentoring responsibilities for indirect reports

Location, Travel and/or Driving Requirements
Remote based position
Travel requirements will be dependent on the client with the expectation of 0-5% annually

Minimum Qualifications The following are the minimum job-related qualifications which an individual needs in order to successfully perform the essential duties and responsibilities of the job

Skills, Knowledge and Abilities

3+ years in the FMCG industry
2+ years of experience in trade analytics, category management, business intelligence, project management or similar
Microsoft Office experience: Highly proficient in Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Syndicated Data experience: Experience with IRI, Nielsen, and other relevant platforms preferred
Exposure to RGM tools or TPx, TPO and/or TPM solutions (i.e. Periscope, Sequoya, Eversight, XTEL, SAP, etc…)
Financial acumen and P&L management with an understanding of the need for rigor regarding spending choices and the importance of ROI
Intellectually curious, eager to problem solve, and a quick learner
Well-organized and strong attention to detail, accuracy, and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to work with large data sets, appetite for numbers and analytics
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work effectively and collaboratively as part of a team; a hunger for “winning together”
Ability to confidently work with client, customer, and internal leadership
Demonstrated ability to effectively prioritize business requests
Creativity…. with a passion for building visually compelling presentations
Good communication – written and oral – skills and strong interpersonal skills
Strong work ethic and desire to succeed (often with minimal supervision)

Environmental & Physical Requirements
Office / Sedentary Requirements
Incumbent must be able to perform the essential functions of the job. Work is performed primarily in an office environment. Typically requires the ability to sit for extended periods of time (66%+ each day), ability to hear the telephone, ability to enter data on a computer and may also require the ability to lift up to 10 pounds.

ABOUT US:

We are aiming to assist underserved communities with culturally specific needs in the Twin Cities, MN. We are looking to build a team of BCBA's that are looking to make a large community impact and improve.

- Knowledge of applied behavior analysis principles and techniques.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
- Ability to work effectively with individuals of all ages and their families.
- Proficient in data collection and analysis methods.

Job Description Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)

The BCBA will provide support to individuals and their families by coordinating and providing services in Applied Behavior Analysis, function analyses and assessment, behavior acquisition and reduction procedures, and adaptive life skills. A BCBA will also oversee programming of associate behavior analysts and provide ongoing support and supervision to Direct Support Professionals (DSP) as it relates to the implementation and documentation associated with Behavior Support Plans.

QUALIFICATIONS

Master's degree in Special Education or related human services field
Successful completion of internship and/or formal training in the analysis of behavior and instructional strategies training related to working with clients who have pervasive developmental disorders and related disorders, their parents, and other agencies working with a client
Ability to demonstrate competence in behavior management skill, instructional skills, oral and written communication, organizational skills and interpersonal relations
Ability to work with a variety of clients regarding age, functionality, and with minimal direction
Certified as a BCBA for a minimum of 2 years unless prior approval is granted by Executive Director.
Knowledge of DTT programming and implementation
Knowledge of Word, Excel and Outlook systems
Ability to utilize a fax machine, phone system, and other office materials as necessary for the position
Ability to respond quickly to phone calls, text messages, and emails
Flexible availability which includes Monday through Friday 3pm-8pm at minimum
Current on all required trainings/certifications (see general list of employment qualifications for list)
Driver's insurance on file with HR Department
Transportation that is reliable and insured in the state of Minnesota

REPORTS TO: Clinical Director

RESPONSIBILIITES:

Function in a supervisory capacity and provide oversight to all areas of programming including the training of direct support professionals, person centered strategies consultants (if applicable) and DSP trainers.
Assist in the development, facilitation, and follow-up training in Applied Behavior Analysis, using both discrete trial training and natural environment training models of teaching.
Facilitate and assist in the development and identification of resources and support information for clients and their families
Provide model teaching and other direct instructional supports including, but not limited to, practicum supervision/teaching, class instruction and in-service instruction to other support professionals.
Assist in the development and implementation of assessment tools, to conduct functional assessments and analyses when appropriate, and to develop appropriate behavior strategies to teach appropriate behavior and reduce maladaptive behaviors.
Provide ongoing support and training to direct support professionals, ABA implementers, and other individuals in support roles for families.
Ongoing training and supervision of paraprofessional staff in implementation of ABA principles and methodology and behavior reduction strategies.
Create ongoing data collection system to establish baseline and programmatic efficacy for all consumers, and to analyze data on a frequent and ongoing basis to guide programming.
Develop behavior plans/treatment plans for all consumers with a focus on teaching and other antecedent strategies for reducing problematic behavior(s).
Meet as needed with supervised staff to discuss ongoing client issues and to provide support when necessary.
Review and sign off on behavior plan/treatment plan training for all field staff and provide field supervision when necessary.
Utilize Set Works website to enter session notes within 72 hours of each session.
Provide consultation services and to maintain ongoing communication with all constituents (other supports, parents, community, and community agencies).
Keep current with the literature, new research findings and resources. In addition, continuing education courses to maintain BCBA certification are necessary (32 credits every 2years).

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Pay: $40,770.00 - $54,889.00 per year
